text: DØE. Hazy golden with a big white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - grass. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish. 190517
From a liter growler purchased at the brewery in Pilsen. Pours a clear orange gold with an off white head. Aroma of fresh, dank grains. Flavors of caramel and toast. Smooth crisp finish.

Draft at Konttori. Thin white head with cloudy amber color. Aroma has smooth floral and hoppy notes. Mouthfeel is smoother than filtered version. Taste has maltiness, hops and some floral notes. Exceptional balance and very nice indeed.

Wyglad: złote, przejrzyste, drobnopecherzykowa piana - szybko znika, pozostaje pierścień piany
Aromat: slomkowe, lekka owocowo, przyjemny diacetyl
Smak: slodowosc, przyjemny diacetyl, goryczka niska, nasycenie średnie

Tap @ Kick. Slightly unclear golden body with a decent white head. Both aroma and flavor is classic pilsner, but has more fruity freshness than found in your average macro pilsner. Very nice soft, smooth malt flavor, fruity yeast, some more fruit in general and a balanced grassy bitterness with a floral touch. Fine balanced body and pleasant aftertaste. Highly drinkable. Im not totally converted, but its for sure a very nice pilsner experience. Maybe the wooden barrel version is even better?
Draft - Grainy and slightly Skunky nose. Clear gold with a decent white head. Lots of grain and a touch of skunk and bitterness. Clean finish.

From draft at the rover, goteborg. Poured a hazy deep golden colour with a white head. Nose has a big amount of crisp wheats, malts, grass notes, floral, fresh cut grass, citrus and soft stone fruits. Big crisp mineral mouthfeel, full fruited, sticky mouthfeel. This stuff is amazing
El ejemplo de las pilsner... ojala todas estuvieran a su altura... Mucho mejor que la filtrada.

16 oz can from friend. Served in a pint glass. Beer is a clear yellowish color with and average white head that actually retains for a whole. Aroma is light and grainly. Taste is lightly sweet and slifhtly bitter near finish. Grainy notes. Lighter carbonation. Lighter bodied beer. Over all an inreresting sample. Always good to mix in some foriegn beers. Not great but not bad. Maybe just not my personal style.

Draught from tank @ [ Malmö Öl & Whisky Festival 2016 ] @ Malmömässan, Mässgatan 6, Malmö, Sweden 21532. [ As Pilsner Urquell Nefiltrovaný ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, sweet malt, pale malt, light cookie, light grain, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter with a average to long duration, sweet malt, pale malt, fruity malt, cookie, light bread. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160402]
 7-3-7-3-15

Draught in the cellars of Pilsner Urquell. Another incredible beer experience straight from the wooden barrels in Plzen. A bready, hoppy flavour strongly rising above the standard taste of pilsner. Leagues above usual pilsner.
I was surprised how different the tast is compared to the filtered Pilsner Urquell. Bitter and fresh hops. Hard to find.

Draught at Tritonia, 12/1/16.Clear, well-carbonated with a large, very firm, white head atop. Deep burnished bronze in color.The nose is full of fresh, aromatic hops contributing both fruitiness (cherries, apples, lemons) and fresh cut, green grass. The perfect amount of dried hay and very light biscuit sits in the background, while a large amount of minerality and light honey play about as well. Absolutely stunningly clean, fresh and with not a single thing to complain about, really.The flavor is more of the same, with a soft, malty, yet well-attenuated texture featuring sourdough drizzled with honey-like maltiness, fresh grass, light floral notes and very gentle lemon and apricot fruit notes. Engaging carbonation and a crisp finish make it incredibly drinkable. Pretty god damned phenomenal and well worth the long wait over the years to finally find this.
Pilsner Urquell sin filtrar. Si la filtrada me gusta, esta me encanta. Una sorpresa.
Sample at the brewery. All pils might be like this. Bread and flowers in aroma and full flavour.
Tirador al Ale&Hop. Cervesa rossa de color ataronjat, molt tèrbola i amb aromes de pa, gra, palla i una mica de flor blanca. Carbonatació alta i cos mig alt. Final sec. Bona.

Tap at Na Parkanu pub, Plzen.

Golden, slightly hazy, creamy high head. Aroma rich malty, cereal, slight dough tones. Palate creamy, low carbonation. Well tapped. Taste balanced, chewy and easily drinkable. A different beast than pasteurised and filtered example.

Tap from Pilsner Urquell Brewery from, fermented and lagered in oak casks.

Aroma 8/10
Appearance 5/5
Palate 5/5
Taste 9/10
Overall 17/20

Golden, very hazy. High creamy head. Very simillar to the one from pub albeit a bit more carbonated but maybe just a different tapping. I liked this one a tiny bit more but technically it really tastes extremely simmilar.
Avalancha de Nefiltrovani por Madrid. Pils de Bohemia como tomarla en su propia fábrica. Tomada en lEurope en perfecto estado. Que dure!
Nice lager good.malty backbone complemented by a slightly sweet and spicy finish. Maybe a bit too heavy thought.

Large serving, perhaps around 20 oz., on tap at World of Beer in St. Paul, Minnesota. Consumed on 11-16-16. Mostly clear but lightly hazy bronze. Not as hazy (let alone cloudy) as I was expecting. Moderate to large amount of long-lasting, fluffy, off-white head. Liquid looks good but head looks great. Good lacing. Fresh noble hops aroma. Fleshly cooked cracker. Pretzel. A bit of spice. Very Eastern Central European in smell. Dry fresh, somewhat beery taste. Very nice, complex finish. Mineral. A lot of dry, borderline bitterness. First couple of sips underwhelmed, but I liked it better after that. Subtle peach. Nice but subtle, lingering, dynamic bitterness in the aftertaste. Easy to drink. Pillowy in palate. Light to medium body. Soft and frothy. Whatever is going on with the palate really works. Really, really good. Lives up to the hype. A fresher, more complex version of the already good original. Very glad I took the opportunity to finally try this one.
Opaque golden yellow, bit lasting, lacing foam head. Barley aroma, some ha noes. Nice fresh beer taste. Again some farm notes, not unpleasant. (Madrid 201611)
La millor Pilsner que he provat, tot i que no soc molt fan de les pilsner.

Inesperada.
Acostumbrado a las cervezas del mismo estilo e incluso a esta misma pero de botella y filtrada, no dejó de sorprender para bien.
Muy turbia, quizás demasiado (barril recién pinchado).
Como no soy experto en catas sólo decir que me tomaría unas cuantas y que si tenéis ocasión de encontrarla, que no es fácil, no lo dejéis pasar.

Probada en el Olut de Sabadell, el taproom de Nómada.
Easy as a pils should be, but plenty of surprises you don?t usually find in the style, white bread and grassy hops . Colorful and hazy. Quite amazing.

Draught at Beer and Beyond shop. Pours hazy yellow golden with a huge creamy head, quite stable and with a nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of earthy noble hops, herbs, yeast and hay. Taste of malt, bread, dough, cereals, biscuit, herbs, finish is bitter. Medium-bodied, smooth and rounded mouthfeel. Very good.

Draught at Beer&Beyond, Tel Aviv. Slightly hazy golden with huge creamy white head. The aroma has notes of yeasts, hoppy, soap, some graininess. Bitter flavor, quite hoppy and bready, some herbs, lemon and flowers, lingering bitterness in the finish. Medium-bodied. Very nice.

At Beer and Beyond shop, Pours golden cloudy with a huge head, aroma of fruits, grain, grass, some green cooked notes, flavor is bitter with caramel, toasted malt, herby, grass, moderate sweetness, medium bodied, pretty quaffable

At barrels and burgers. Pours unclear amber, good and very stable white head. Smell is full , lageryeast, malty. Taste is very full, lageryeast, very crispy malts. Absolutely fantastic lagerbeer. Ive had and loved unfilteres lagers before, but this, indeed, is another step higher up the ladder. Very Nice one ! Very Surprised to have found this one, out of the Blue, but i double checked and both staff and menu assured me it was the unfiltered/unpastaurized version. Cool !
From tap at Chinaski Lavapies, Madrid. Hazy golden orange color with white head. Malty and light hoppy aroma, grass, citrusy, grainy. Sweet and bitter taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

On cask at the Brewpublic Killer Beer Fest at Baileys Taproom. Colour...mostly clear gold with a corpulent white head. Nose...honey, honeycomb and jasmine flower. Palate...full, frothy, plush and velveteen with cereal, malt powder and fresh water crackers. The mid palate is dry and bright and the finish is incredibly clean. Very nice stuff!

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2016 On cask at the upper lip. Pours a clear copper color with a medium white head. A big sweet pils malt nose. The flavor is big sweet biscuit, lemons, zesty, pepper. So clean. Very distinct from the regular version, way more flavor, yeasty, more shall I say Belgian in character. But the kicker here is smoothness, insanely smooth and tasty.
From tap at DØE 2016. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, bread and a bitter finish.

Pours a slightly hazy golden color with medium white head. Earthy aroma, cereals, bread and malts. Taste follos the aroma, earthy, cerealy, bready, biscuity, grasy and malty. Strong bitter finish to it.
Tap at Tabačka. Clear golden colour with huge stable head off. Aroma of malts, bread.Taste of bread , malts, full body, soft carbonation, creamy, bitter finish, great version of Pilsner Urquell.

Tap @ sbwf. Pours a clear golden colored liquid and a creamy, lasting offwhite head. Nice and fresh malty aroma with spicy hops, grass, hay, yeast. Hints of citrus, diacetyl. Crisp malty taste, spicy with grass, hay, flowers and fresh baked bread. Balanced bitterness.

Sampled from tap at BierCab. Clear, golden yellow with a slightly creamy, slowly diminishing, white head. Moderately fruity-grassy, slightly floral aroma of citrus, fresh grass and hints of honey. Slightly sweetish, moderately fruity-grassy, a little floral and a bit grainy taste of sweet malts, fresh grass, some citrus and hints of crackers, followed by a short, moderately bitter, grassy-spicy and slightly yeasty taste. Medium body, very smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Very good Lager!
Tap @ BierCab, Barcelona. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Hops, grass, grain, bread crusts. Lovely.
Draft at BierCaB, RBESG 2016. Cloudy orange with big white head. Aroma of malt, grain, light fruits, yeasty touch. Flavour is light sweet and bitter. Above light bodied with light carbonation.
Quite good and very malty. Creamy in features and very refreshing. Not annoying and excellent to taste.

Gravity cask on the brewery tour, Pilsen. Large tight white head. Cloudy yellow gold amber body. On the nose is as follows. Yeast, dough, grass, hops, caramel, pale malt, cheddar, blue cheese and the Saaz hop. Tangerines, red fruits and Rich Tea biscuit. Taste is sweet, with some alkaline flavour from the yeast. Very dry finish. Creamy mouth feel. Light carbonation. Long finish. The benchmark for pilsner, a world leading beer with great depth.
Keg at steampunk. Hazy orange, white head. Grass, honey, fruity. Nice body, fuller than most lagers. Great pills
Tap at Alfa. Yeast aroma with malty notes. Clear golder color and thick white head. Taste is malty with pleasant bitterness. Medium body, oily texture, average carbonation and bitter finish.

9th July 2016: on-tap in BierCaB Barcelona with the RBESG guys. Very surprised to find I have never rated this having been to Prague twice on beer centric trips. Anyway pleased to find it in Barcelona. Cloudy, dull golden pour with a large white head on top. Aroma was both slightly malty and grassy, the taste was led by light molasses with some grass and herbal traces in a yeasty environment.
Tåkete lys brun med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Nesten luktfri, noe søtlig maltekstrakt. Lett. noe bitterhet

Tap at BierCaB in Barcelona. I got a bit overexcited when I saw this on their tap menu but that was after a few drinks :-). Served in a small version of a typical beer mug. Hazy golden with huge white head. Very grassy, light caramel, pils malts, herbal hops. Just lots of nice herbal notes with soft yeast and pilsmalts. Medium bitter and over light sweet. Over light bodied. Nice!
Overall: Bread, lemon, grass, fruity notes.Note: Cask at Bar Central. Reviewed 2016-07-09.
Cloudy golden with white head. Floral, cereal, and grounded malt. Slick, hoppy, dry and super crisp finish. Overall: wow!

Draught
Aroma-bread, grass, 
Appearance-orange, cloudy, white foam, 
Taste-light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good
UPDATED: MAY 28, 2016 Aroma : good Appearance : a little dark gold  Taste : Honey Appropriate hop  Palate : no more than this light bodied nice finish Best in the world Cezch in Czech U Flekú

Bar central vasastan med lill och stor Bettan och SJanne. Mild mild fyllig balanserad .
Utsökt pilsner !

On tap Na parkánu, Pilsen, Czech Republic. Hazy golden with creamy big white head, leaving lacing. Malty aroma, very light taste. Malty sweetness, but less aroma then the filtered version. They are alike, but this ones not better. I dont get it. Going to the brewery tomorrow to ask them whats the big deal.

Tap in gothenburg the rover
Pours bright slightly hazy orange hue with a small fizzy white head and sparse lacing. Nose is grassy grainy and slightly metallic. Flavors are saaz hops bright lager yeast and nice grainy flavors. Fantastic! Long dry finish lots of grassy notes and grains. Fantastic pilsner! Grateful to have this beer next to our beer buddy Gnoff.

On tap @ Biercab, Barcelona - ES. Color: clear golden blond beer with medium carbonation and medium white foam. Smell: nice malt and cereal nose. Honey presence. Nice sweet notes. Taste: light body with superb sweet malt taste. Caramel and honey notes. Fruity, really easy drinkable, fresh and with superb attenuation. Perfect drinkable beer for summer. Aftertaste: malt and cereal with sweet finish.

Gravity at The Pilsner Urquell Brewery, Plzen. A hazy golden colour with a thick white head. Aroma of bready malts, grain and fresh, spicy, herbal Saaz hops. Taste of bready malts, grain, slight pepper, a little grass, subtle honey and spicy, herbal hops. Light bodied and moderate carbonation. A long, dry, herbal hop bitterness in the finish. Can taste all the high quality ingredients used. Suburb crisp bitterness in the finish. Worth the trip.

1/2 Pint on tap @Barcelona Beer Festival. Pours transparent golden with big dense white head. Both aroma and taste are fruits, caramel, and the characteristic Pilsner malt touch. Finish is dry with moderate bitterness. Light/medium body, perfect carbonation. Definitely the best Pilsner Ive had so far.

On tap at Biercab Barcelona. AROMA: predominant spicy hop aroma, followed by a grainy and slight sweet malt background. APPEARANCE: strong gold color to light ambar and slightly hazy. moderate creamy white head with good retention. TASTE: mild spicy hop flavour with a grainy-malty note with a honey-like impression. medium bitterness with a semi-dry finish. PALATE: medium-low body with slight creaminess. average carbonation. OVERALL: a more robust and flavorful version of the bottled version.
On tap at Bar Maquila. Waiting for lunch with Pedro & Miguel. More pleasant than the bottled version, without any artificial taste. However, it neither is something specially memorable
Wooden barrel at Braukunst Live. Hazy golden color with tan head. A bit buttery, grassy and earthy hops, taste is earthy, grassy, and buttery hops. Crisp, bitter, balanced. *The* Czech Pilsner.

Dark yellow color. NIce noble hop aroma with a bit of biscuit. Has a richer flavor than the filtered version. A bit more depth. However, it isnt going to make pilsner converts. Nice bitterness to balance the smooth light maltiness.

Caña en el Lúpulo y en Cimmeria en varias ocasiones 1 a 12 de febrero 2016. Color dorado amarillento algo velado con buena espuma blanca. Aromas y sabores maltosos frescos herbáceos. Ligeros toques citicos y amargo final suave. cuerpo medio algo pastoso y espumoso fácil de beber. Bastante buena y sobre todo comparada con la comercial. Para repetir sin duda.

Un excelente marketing, pero sin embargo no es nada impresionante que siempre recordarás. Eso sí, mejora a su hermana mayor, es muy refrescante y bien equilibrada. Creo q cada vez será más fácil encontrarla.

On. Tap. @El Cabanón, Avilés 04/02/2016
Color dorado, sabor malta, notas herbales, final amargo moderado, cuerpo medio, rica y muy fácil de beber.

Hm, not sure about this one. The blackboard claims that this is the nefiltrovaný, but to me its not very different from the regular Urquell. Due to language difficulties I didnt bother asking the staff to clarify. It pours a slightly hazy (so, nefiltrovaný after all?), golden body, with a white, long-lived head. Moderate aroma of pale malts, noble hops and light caramel, quite like any other high-quality pilsner. Moderate flavour that follows the aroma, with additional citric hints. Light sweet taste with a moderate bitter finish. Mid-bodied, dry and with a moderate carbonation. A nice pilsner, but nothing special. 
[15 cl sample from tap @ Irreale, Madrid]

Random spotted in Prag. Pours hazt golden with a white head. Aroma of hops(saaz as always), bready, fresh, citrusy, grassy. Taste is sweet and hoppy bread mixed very well. Extreme drinkability on this dude.
Draught. Golden colour, hazy, frothy head. Nose of yeast, mild herbs. Medium bitterness. Grassy, fresh, fairly balanced taste.
The best overall beer in the world, well they started 1842, so they have had a long time to adjust the recepi and process.
grass, hay, toast, roasty, golden, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, oily feel, soft carbonation,
Draught. Golden colour, hazy, frothy head. Aroma is intensive herbal happiness, much different than in typical Czech pisleners. Medium bitterness. Very good.
Hazy golden color with a white head with good retention. Aroma has notes of Czech hops with some bready hints. Flavor is sligtly bittery, creamy mouthfeel with some sweetness in the final.

On tap.
Opal deeper golden colour, bigger sized stabile white head.
Nose of yeast, mild herbs...
Aroma brings biscuits, dough, some flowers and herbs, smooth slick mouthfeel.
Bittersweet, herbal hoppy finish.
Refined, very nice.

NaPa. Full, rich, really rewarding on the palate. Big hops (especially from the cellar), caramel, lengthy body. Really demands repeat drinks. Just a great beer, with a great history from a great little town.
Nice aroma, but whats really nice is the taste. Really nice pilsner taste good bitterness and dryness and citrus.
Writing this from memory. Cloudy gold, huge white head. Grassy, fresh, fairly balanced taste.
En af de bedst humlede øl der findes. En typisk gedigen øl som man med glæde ser frem til at nyde,, når man endelig befinder sig i Prag. At den er ufiltreret gør den kun bedre.

Tap / Tirador.
@ XXXII, Sevilla, España.
A: Golden / Dorado.
T/S: Malt, cereal, bitter, slightly hoppy / Malta, cereal, amargo, ligeramente a lupulo.

Plastic Bottle 1.5l from bro ippopotamo36.Taste with cika Boban and cika Alberto in Vranovo Serbia. 25.09.2015.Thank you bro for bringing this in Serbia. Pour it little bit hazy golden color with medium white head.Aroma malty and some yeast feel.Good palate, Taste of apple, pear, some nutty feel, grassy hops Saaz.Nice balanced smooth finish.Totally different from regular, really good.I hope I will try one day directly fresh.This bottle was one week old.

Gravicask (OlutExpo2015) wooden cask
Super grainy aroma. Lovely hazy pale orange. Such raw fresh grains, its magical on the nose. I could swim in this. Alas its a bit duller in the mouth - lightly bready grains. Finish is pleasantly hopped, just a little bit of dry crisp spiciness. Super drinkable. Smooth palate, like a good hazy unfiltered lager should be. Well, this is a good beer to help you shed your prejudices - who cares if this is SABMiller, this is a beautiful lager.

Little tun @Olutexpo 2015. Clear golden color. Huge size, thick white head, stays. Not much of aroma. Tiny bit of yeast and wheat. Nice malty body with moderately spicy hops. Nice hoppy bitterness. Everything is in balance. Very drinkable.

Tap. Slightly hazy golden with an average white head. Aroma of grassy hops, hay, grain and caramel notes. Sweet flavor that ends up dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily texture and average carbonation. A very nice Pils indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟
Lightly hazy, dark golden color with a medium white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of toast, honey, grassy hops. Taste of dough, earth, toffee, biting grassy hop finish.

Hmmm what is there to say about this that have not been said before. Probably nothing. If you stumble upon this rating, you might believe it is an happy rating. I rarely give any pilsner any higher rating than 3. But this pilsner make you realize how pilsner really should be. Not all the crap you usually get. Looks lovely with its hazed golden color and two finger thick white head. Solid lacing down the glass. Both aroma and flavor are dominated by a lovely mellow and smooth malt aroma. Lovely fresh bitterness. Medium body and a pleasant creamy soft carbonation. One more please![On tap from a wooden barrel at Forest & Brown in Oslo, Norway]

Draught at W.o.Rs. Poured a deep gold under an average white head. Aroma is earthy, straw, hay, honey, grass and a light hint of green grapes. Flavor is the same. Medium to fuller bidy that is almost chewy with average carbonation and a lingering aftertaste.

Tap @ Highlanders Aarhus. Pours like pilsner. Golden with a white head. Aroma of pilsner malts, grassy hops, bread and some weak nutty and honey notes as well. The taste has some bread, some classic saaz hops, pilsner malt and some weak sweeter malts as well. Refreshing but yeah - a good pilsner.

Draft at Na Parkanu and in various other pivnice round and in Plzen.
Quite different from the bottled version, more floral and somewhat yeasty.
It seems not to be the same beer. Big white head, hazy pale in color.
Not so good as I expected but still a great beer.

Draught at Black Door. Hazy light amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, biscuit, malts, a bit of earthy notes and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, hops, toast and malts. Very nice czech pilsner.
Tap @ Highlanders, Aarhus. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy, corn, bread, pilsner malt, light citrus. Taste is hoppy, pilsner malt, grain, bread, citrus, corn.
On tap at Blue Dog. Pours clear straw yellow with soapy white head. Aroma of grain, corn, and fruit. Fruity sweetness with corn and grain. Very nice beer for its style.

Cloudy golden color, rich white head. Slightly sulphuric aroma. Extremely smooth flavor with rich malts and balanced hops. Medium body, medium carbonation. Wonderful pilsener!

Pours a mildly hazy yellow body with a creamy white head that leaves lacing on the glass. Nice hoppy nose with earthy and somewhat spicy noble hop aromas. Dry taste with a bitter punch and a lingering puckering dryness on the finish. Soft carbonation and light easily drinkable mouthfeel. Excellent balance and smoothness, a bit dank hop aroma.
Erstaunlich, wie malzig dieses Piwo doch daherkommt. Wunderbar süffig, leicht blumig, eine leichte Muffigkeit zum Schluss, daneben aber frisch und mehr als einfach zu trinken. Super.

Sampled at Finest Spirits & Beer Convention in Bochum. The beer has got a light hazy golden colour with a steady head and medium body. Aroma of hops, amlt, bread and mild fruits. Taste of mild hops, malt, bread, mild fruits and basement. Mild hoppy-malty finish.

Growler from Na Parkanu, shared 24 hours later @Bir&Fud (Rome). Thank you so much Ryan! Pours cloudy golden with a medium white head. Aroma is bready, biscuits, some grassy notes, light butter, not perfectly clean. Flavour is well balanced with a nice bitter end. Medium body, medium carbonation. Ok, but I expected more.

At Na Parkanu in Plzen-CZ, with Mowbeer (twice). Pours a cloudy and bright golden color, a bit orange with a huge frothy white foam (very adhesive). Nose: floral-grassy Salz hops, fresh harvested grass, the nose is mostly dominated by this fresh bouquet. Awesome aroma! Mouth: again aggressively bitter, grassy, a bit creamy. Clean and definitely on the bitter side. Recalls the great Franconian gravity barrels. The most appreciable thing in both the mouth and the nose is the pureness of the local hops.

Tap at Highlanders Aarhus. Pours a clear golden with a big, white head. Aroma is hoppy, pilsner malty, slight bread, slight grass. Very fresh actually. Taste is fresh up front, and then gets more malty and beaded. Slight hoppy bitterness to finish off. Mediumhigh carb and light body. Good pilsner that stays true to it's style.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma and taste is malty and grassy hoppy, straw, hay, crisp on the palate, goes down very well.

Tap delivered same day @ Highlanders , 4.4%. Slightly hazy golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, grass, straw and a little grainy. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, grass, straw, little earthy, little grainy, medium sweet and quite bitter.

Tap at Taphouse in Copenhagen. The real unfiltered found its way to cph. Hazy yellow white head. Dry aroma. Yeasty notes and perhaps a little bit of dough. The filtered one is much more perfumy or flowery in comparison. Flavor is yeasty malty and euro hoppy. Some sweet notes too. Filtered is cleaner and a little less yeasty. Palate is decisively softer and nicer in the unfiltered version. Somehow the unfiltered has the best overall taste to it. But both are fine specimens. As I see it the unfiltered is overrated at ratebeer , probably not the best of its kind.

Tap, finally! Pours slight cloudy very clean goldenwith creamy white head. Aroma is crisp, pilsner malt, earthy spicy hops, slight flowery. Subtle caramel. Taste is super fresh, hoppy, spicy, sweet pale malt, biscuit. Smooth body and long crisp quite bitter finish. Spicy hops.
Standard pilsner. Light and good to drink ever time............................  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

FYI this beer is possible to get from bars other than the brewery bar. I got it from tap at The Rover, Göteborg. 
Grass, earth, yeast, bread, herbs, flowers. Balanced beer, medium bitter and medium sweet.

Straight from the barrel (or at least thats what its made to look like) during the brewery tour. Much more enjoyable than the ordinary version (though the ambience certainly played a role), I wish this was more widely sold as Id drink more Pilsner Urquell if it was! (Different rating format as I have no proper tasting notes)
Straight from the source. I can pretend to imagine drinking this beer as a Medieval Belgian peasant.

8/VII/15 - on tap @ the beer museum (Plzen) - BB: n/a (2015-882)  Thanks to Motelpogo for the beer and food!
Bit hazy orange to deep blond beer, huge creamy off-white head, very stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: yeast (top fermenting, very specific smell), brewery, wort, little metallic. MF: soft carbon, full body, smooth creamy texture. Taste: bit sweet, malty touch, fruity notes, soft bitterness, citrus. Aftertaste: bit fruity, nice bitter hops, grassy, very creamy and smooth finish. Its really amazing how much better this beer is, unfiltered and straight from tap! So much fuller, richer, creamier, tastier. Lovely beer and should be again Czechs number 1 beer, totally deserved! (when writing this, the n°1 beer is Matuska Stout with 18 ratings)

Youll have to get this only in Plzen CZ: Look; mafioso off white tight standing head, hazy strawy gold-golden body, crocheted small curtains everywhere inside the mug.
Aroma; bread, straw, hops, grains, malts - clean straightforward perfect start. Taste; mafioso malts, leafy hops, bread, butter, meadow spices, sweet butterscotch. Finishes softly blended 2/3 malts and 1/3 fine fresh hops, OMG !. Feels well balanced, clean, just a little oily, but also the tiny oil contains the finest malts. Overall probably the best beer ever. Best pils in the world, pitty that theres never any bottled version. Tap @ The Rover. Deep golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of hops, caramel, sweet malts, hay, biscuits and some light lemon. Gewd!
Cardinal 011114. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit, grass, hay. Medium body. OK beer.
This is really the greatest example of the style, crisp, grassy, straw, hay, packed with flavour, hazy golden colour, white head. Exquisite.
Straight from the barrel @Pilsner Urquell brewery. Cloudy golden colour with white head. Aromas of honey and lots of malts, very fresh and yeasty. Taste: malts, yeast, hops. Balanced and very tasty.

Kufel w Browarze w Pilznie. Kolor złoty, klarowne, piana średnia stoi długo. Aromat słodowy, chmielowy, lekko owocowy. Smak słodowo-chmielowy aromatyczny chleb.Średnio nagazowane. Nie mogłem opuścic piwnic w browarze. Bardzo dobry pilsner, wręcz kultowy.

Sample at En Öl- & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg, April, 2015. Three 25 litres kegs were brought along from the brewery, this was sampled from the first one opened. Clear deeep golden, soft, thick white four finger foam dissipating slowly leaving lots of lacings. Amazingly present aroma, with a wall of grass, floral, bready, slightly buttery feel. Taste is medium bitter, superb balance with bready, malty hints along with floral and grassy notes, velvet mouthfeel, slight bitterness in the finish. Sample at en öl och whiskymässa 2015, Göteborg. Hazy golden with white head. Smell is floral and fruity, Taste is floral citric hoppy with a bit of butter and fruit.

Pours medium gold with a foamy white head. Nose is malt andBody and carbon is light, body is tight. Taste is rather bitter and dry. Palate mostly dominated by malt and hops. Tap. Little hazy golden body, medium white head. Aroma of malts and yeast, low intensity. Taste of malts, aftertaste is bitter, hoppy. Little sweet, medium bitterness. An average body and carbonation.What kind of madness is around here? This is really an average pilsener, I cant understand this 4,x ratings. Draught at the Pivovarská enkovna, Ústí n. L. (easter edition 2015). Little cloudy, golden colored beer. Aroma of malt, bread, some sweet fruity or flowery tones. Medium bodied, malty flavor, bready, moderately hopped.  Not bad, still it is average beer. Definitely not the best Czech pilsener.

Has a slight buttery popcorn diacetyl character in the nose. But the flavors are crackery malts with a slightly grassy hoppiness imparting medium bitterness for style; not as tame as more generic pils, less exotic than the Italian exemplars of style. Quite easy to drink and tasty to boot. Meets my expectations and I had to travel all the way to a World of Beer to try it rather than going back to my Grandmothers homeland.
Pretty much as boring as the regular urquell, that means it works when in emergency situations, but not otherwise.
Es nuestra pilsner favorita. On tap en OMA bistró. Dorada con una abundante corona blanca. Notas de caramelo, ligera, chispeante y refrescante. Carbonatación media y amargor ligero. La pilsner ideal.

Softly hazed and golden, with a head of tightly packed white. Corn, biscuits, honey and crackers on the malt side of the nose -- a lot of malty complexity. The hops are soft here, lending an herbal, minty twang to the proceedings. Compared to the standard draft and bottled versions, its got a lot more malt character -- again the rich melanoidins of crackers and honey. The barley is balanced perfectly by tea-like hops. A lot of complexity in this little old Pilsner.

On tap @WOB-Appleton. Seriously lucky to try this. Pours a hazy orange/gold in color. Huge, frothy, white head leaves plenty of lacing all the way down. Aromas of grain, malt, and grassy hops. Taste is well balanced between bready malts, sweet grains, and grassy hops. Light to medium sweet, with some perceived bitterness. Very smooth and incredibly drinkable.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Orange, gelb. In der Nase hopig, Malznoten, recht würzig, Hefe, minimal schweflig. Am Gaumen pilsig, würzig, Malzkörper. Sehr gutes Pils.

Had CZ-based people not already introduced me to unfiltered Bohemian pilsner goodness like Kout, this would have opened the BKL with a revelation that Urquell, traditional representative of CZ pilsners, can have actual malt character: Rich malts, textured like sawdust and seasalt, assaulting the palate with a Saaz-aided bite. on tap at Braukunst Live, Munich. dark orange, hazy color, big white head. smells of grain, yeasty, medium body, very slick mouthfeel, big taste of grains, bread, burned grains, light dry / grainy finish.

On tap, u2p. Light hazy pale body, medium head. Aroma is yeasty, noble, malty. Taste has high sweetness, mostly malty with well balanced noble profile. body is full, high carbonation. Amazing drinkability.

(tap 0,5l @ U2P (Brno))
Aroma: Malty, hops. 
Appearance: Hazy golden. Medium white head.
Taste: Medium sweet, medium bitter. Light hops. Well balanced.
Palate: Medium body. Creamy texture. Bitter finish.
Overall: Ok, this is The Pilsner Urquell worth its name, not the boring below average stuff that they sell in bottles and in most pubs...
UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 Una de las mejores pilsner que he probado, refrescante, sutil al paladar y muy deliciosa
Bottle. Good pilsener. I dont like this style but this beer is good. Nice bitterness.

At na parkanau Plzen with Sarah. Aroma is yeasty, fresh pils grains and earthy spicy hops. Hazed golden bright coloured pour with a steadfast sticky white froth. Flavour is earthy spicy hops married with fresh yeast lager yeast, sweet grains. Palate is semi crisp, highish carbonation and slightly grainy on the tongue. Complex, balanced and very easy to sink. A joy. Wish there wasnt some idiots smoking beside me.

From barrel at the brewery tour. Slightly hazy gold pour with thin creamy white head. Aroma is really nice, rich lightly caramelized malt notes with fresh grassy, herbal hop notes. Taste is super smooth but very flavorful, nice sweet malty taste with a lingering bitter finish. Palate is light, light carbonation, so easy to drink.

Ive enjoyed this beer since tasting it first in 1958 at the American[!] Embassy booth at the Brussels Worlds Fair. Ive never found a pilsner that MATCHES it for taste aroma, &, especially, aftertaste. A batch of Canadas (St Catherines Brewery) Moevenpick Pilsner seemed at least as good to me in about 1996, but later rounds of that brew were not as satisfying.

From keg at Cafe Sara
Pours golden hazy with a massive creamy white head. Smell of grassy hops and spice, light malts. Light sweet, very crisp and refreshing, dry mouthfeel. Ends with a moderate to medium bitter finish. Grassy and spicy from the saaz. Quite nice, but not extraordinary better than the normal bottled and canned version

Draught @ Cardinal, Stavanger
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, grain, hay and grass. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with a long grainy and grassy finish. Body is medium, texture is tihn to oily, carbonation is soft.
Draught @ Queens Head, Stockholm. Nice, refreshing, well balanced in many respects.

Tap , Na Parkanu , Pilsen , CZ , Malt,hay,bread,fruity and nice grassy aroma , Cloudy golden color with huge lacing creamy head , Sweeter taste with nice bitter finish , Fuller body , Soft carbon , Just best beer of its category.

Hazy golden body, whtie head. Aroma has Frisky malt, fresh and soft notes. Flavour is well balanced between noble hops and grainy maltiness. Bitterness in aftertaste. Some residual sweetness. Just great.
Best czech pilsner ever. Taste as straw, brown sugar and wood. Big white head. Yummy!

Caoba claro y tupido con espuma blanca algo irregular. Aromas de fruta madura, azúcar moreno,
 florales y cereal. Cuerpo medio, textura maltosa, inicio ligeramente dulce de la malta, que recuerda por momentos a la manzana roja, un toque floral que acaba en un amargor seco moderado. Muy rica.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2016 01.11.2014, tap @ Cardinal:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is slightly dry grainy, hay, dried grain, popcorn, caramel, weeds, light malts, grass. Taste is dry and crisp, hay, light malts, paper, wet grain, weeds, minerals. Medium to longlasting bitterness, dry slightly harsh mouthfeel. Fair enough.

On tap at Cardinal. It pours a lightly hazy unclear body under a dense two finger white head. Nice curtains. Light piney nose, with grass and and hay, some generic fruit notes and resins. It has a nice, subtle bitterness lurking in the back, with resins, pine cones and fruityness up front. Its very soft and smooth on the palate, dry and pleasantly carbonated, with a pleasant bitterness in the end. Damn, this is something different from the regular industrial pilsners. Im not blown away, but its sure nice. 141101

Keg at Cafe Sara, october 17th 2014. Clear golden body with a huge white head. Aroma of noble hops, herbs, light fruits, malt. Mild toasty taste with earth, flowers, grass. Thick grainy and flowery finish, lasting bitterness. Maybe not as good as its hype, but definately one Im happy to have had the chance to taste!

Fra fat på Cardinal, Mandag i annen: endelig får vi smake denne klassikeren, hurra for Cardinal! Lett uklar gylden med fint hvitt skum. Herlig frisk aroma, smak og ettersmak, alt med en elegant bitterhet (Saaz/Zatek er nærliggende å anta). Slik skal en pilsner smake! En fornøyelse å la denne renne over ganen, og der var flere enn meg som tok seg en påfyll.

From the cask in the cellar at the brewery. Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma of cereals, bread, biscuit. Taste is similar, bready yeast, cereals, grain. Very soft carbonation, crisp and refreshing. Decent

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2014 From tap at Mi2 at Cardinal 27.10.14 and from tap at Na Parkanu in Pilzn 11.12.14. Hazy pale golden. White head. Aroma of Czech hops, flowers, fresh grass and yeast. Very refreshing taste and aftertaste. Well-balanced with bitterness.
On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours deep golden, slightly hazy. Aroma of bread and malt, some hops, with quite some sulfur. Fresh taste, with some bread, grain and well-balanced bitterness.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 On tap at Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. Fairly clear golden colour (beginning of keg, will probably be hazier towards the end). Large white head. Strong aroma of herbal hops (Saaz, I assume), hints of butterscotch as expected, but not disturbing, Lovely and fresh hoppy and herbal character throughout in the flavour, distinct bittering hops in the finish.

On tap at Janoinen Lohi, Helsinki. A color of hazy amber, medium-sized frothy head - a beautiful appearance, all in all. The aroma displays pale, grainy and bready maltiness and some herbal hoppiness. Taste is dryish and malt-driven; some balancing hoppy bitterness in the finish that is somewhat abrubt. Bread, hay and cereal provide a solid basis for the flavours. Hoppiness adds a fresh touch. The palate is light to medium bodied, very drinkable with soft carbonation. Fresher than the regular Urquell.

Sunset orange beer with a white head. Mild aroma. Soft texture combined with a crispy carbonation. Bitterness grows progressively towardsvräthe aftertaste. Notes of butter are more on the back ground in this version. A really nice and balanced pilsner. One of the best beers for any occasion.

Tap @ Sivukirjasto, Helsinki. Pours a slgihtly hazy, orange with a good, white head. Aroma is grass and herbs. Taste is very herbal, very dry, quite a bit of grainy, pale malts. Some yeast. Fairly full with medium carbonation. Pretty easy drinkability
Tap at Olutexpo 2014. Hazy yellow. With medium head. Malty. Medium Bitterness.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

0.5L at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Hazy gold color, big white head. From the wooden barrel at an event at the Windsor Castle W8, sampled next to the standard stuff served in pubs here. Deeper colour, hints of amber, hazy. Medium head. I do think its not as rich as the Urquell I remember from the Plzen trip in 1998, hard to tell whether my palate or the recipe are responsible for this change.
Got to have it on draft - out of the bottle just doesnt do this beer justice
På fat. Riktigt god pilsner. Smak och doft av humle,, malt, jäst med toner av karamell och örter. Jämn och len. Fruktig med fin beska. Välbalanserad och lagom sötma. Karaktär.
Quite good pilsener, way better that filtered v. Malty, light caramel notes, sometimes doughy. Fizzy carbonation, not so stable head, hazy. Classic interpretation.

Aroma: grain and cereal malts, light caramel. Appearance: hazy pale gold, creamy. Taste: light sweet. Palate: light bitters intensify quickly, medium bitter an light dry in the average-long finish, malty throughout, grain and cereal. Overall: very nice Pilsener, very refreshing, surprisingly complex and satisfying. Pint at a Wooden Barrel Event at the Windsor Castle, Kensington.
Bottle. Great crisp pilsner. Some citrus comes through. Yeast and malts asc well.

From oak barrel @ Plzensky Prazdroj brewery tour 20140729. Pours hazy straw. Good head retention. Aroma is malty and spicy with some yeast tones. Taste is similar with a lot of yeast and a nice aroma hoppyness.

Prágában ittam egy kis fogadóban, ezért a sörért visszamennék. :)
A habja a végiég kitartott, a színe gyönyörű volt, az íze pedig leírhatatlan. Az eddigi legfinomabb szűretlen sör, amit valaha ittam.

Draught at Taste of Toronto festival - pulled from one of 11 kegs flown over especially for the event. As I was wandering around enjoying the lovely weather and great food while I was drinking it, I didnt take any explicit notes, but it struck me as being "a more Urquell-ish Urquell", if that makes any sense. It had all the characteristics I like about regular Urquell, but pumped up a few notches, especially the flavour. Really great stuff.
First in canada on tap avt wvst. Lacy head. Very smooth mouthfeel.Good pilsner with some bitterness in finish.

Draught at Bishops Arms. Cloudy, golden colour with a light amber tint. Dense, white head. Sweet aroma with grasses - the grass hops bite as is Urquells trademark is definitely there - fruits, pale malts and hay. Taste is light bitter. Medium body with a creamy texture and an average carbonation. Finishes dry and bitter with grasses, fruits and hay. Must taste this one fresh in the Czech Republic.

.5l draft at The Rover in Gothenburg. Great, slight hazed gold. Heavy thick foam. Rich sweet pils aroma. Hop, malt. Great heavy yeast, much fuller flavor, herb and soft fruit. Great full flavor. A treat with perfume and a great hop bite. Lives up to hype, and might be the best lager Ive ever tried.
Draught in Plzen.Hazy dark amber colour with medium white fluffy head.Aroma of fresh hops grass and spices,nice refreshing with fine complex flavour and well balanced mouthfeels and crispy finish.

another beer that should have been rated ages ago, sampled most recently in dublin
dry, full bodied cereal with herbal bitterness and creamy mouthfell, long bitter finish. Not as good as when i had it in czech rep or leeds but better than in edinburgh...very sensitive to travel it seems

Wooden Cask @ EBBC14, Dublin [270614]

Pours medium orangey gold, foamy white head, good retention. Doughy pilsner malt for days, spicy grassy hops not too strong. Bready taste but still fairly dry, way more flavor than the normal stuff. Full mouthfeel but still light and easy to drink

Pleased to find this one at the White Horse, Soho. From an oak barrel, into a glass tankard. Drunk outside in the sunny streets of soho. Hazy orange, big foamy white head, thin lacing. Aroma - malty, yeast, slightly sour and vegetal, some wheaty character. Body is medium, a bit foamy, light carbonation. Taste - very bready - lots of wholemeal bread, watery citrus, very slight esters, dental rinse, lightly astringent (maybe a touch of oak adds to this impression), bit of salt - definitely leans towards savoury rather than sweet. Long, softly bitter finish. This is a good beer, but I was expecting something a bit better.

pours a clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma of grain, malt, and yeast. Taste of solid balanced grain and malt, nice dry crisp light hops, with yeast. This a solid Pilsner, refreshing and easy drinking, a great example of the style

No té res a veure amb la Urquell normal, és molt més aromàtica i gustosa.

Tap at the Rover, Goteborg, 23/03/14.

Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Solid pils, crisp, clean, refreshing.

text: From notes. On tap at Romans. Poured lightly cloudy golden with a thick, well-retained white head. The aroma picked up chewy, crisp bready notes with fresh lemon zest accents.. very well presented. The flavor found similar.. tasty bread and very light nutty notes at the core with crisp lemon and light earthy hoppage around.. clean, tasty finish. Light-medium bodied, but fairly filling on the palate.. flowed very well.. this was excellent!

From cask @ the cellars of the old brewery at Plzensky Prazdroj, Plzen. An epic tick; this one embodies the heart of lager beer and the Czech pilsner tradition! :-) Hazy, near-cloudy light orange body, large, long-lasting creamy white head. Aroma is pale malts, mild diacetyl, fresh yeasty notes, grains and hints of dry grass and straw. Taste is pale malts, fresh yeast, grains and soft hop notes that intensify into dry, grassy bitterness in the finish. Creamy, soft palate, soft to medium carbonation. Just a great pilsner, and a milestone for me. Na zdravi! :-)
@Braukunst Live 2013. Trübes goldgelbes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch hopfig malzig, grasig, getreidig. Geschmack hopfig bitter, malzig, getreidig.

How: Draught.
Where: The Bishops Arms (Folkungagatan), Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour witha white head.
Aroma: Citrus, yeast, spices, malt, floral.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Hops, grass, floral, some metal. Bitter finish.

Cask @ White Horse (London). Unfiltered and unpasteurized version. Almost clear golden with a frothy white head and intense lacing. Aroma is of fresh gress, Saaz hops, floral notes and light breadied malt. Taste is of wet cereals, grass, breadied malt, light spiciness (from Saaz hops?) and light herbal bitterness. Light/medium body. Soft carbonation. Almost creamy/chewy mouthfeel. Fresh. This beer is amazingly drinkable (I drank 750 ml in half an hour) and thirst quenching (hmmm maybe not the much, I would have taken more!). What is great about this beer is every component of the aroma and taste are so fresh (fresh grass, fresh bread, fresh floral notes, etc.). Really tasty for such and low abv and highly drinkable beer. Loved it!

Tap at the Rover, Gothenburg. Poured a clear straw colour with a thin white head. The aroma is malt, yeast. The flavour is medium bitter with a smooth chewy malt yeast light floral palate. From the source. Hazy gold color. Nice foamy head. Taste almost lighter and kess than the filtered version. Very good.
On tap at Biercab. Hazy golden colour with white head. Malt, hoppy, grass and cereal aroma. Sweet, malt, cereal and grass taste, some bitterness. Light to medium body.
Tap. Hazy orange body with white head. Aroma is some herbs some grass. Taste is some malts and I always taste some cardboard. Aftertaste is medium bitter. O.K.one but I also dont get the hype.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2014 Draught at Braukunst Live 2014, Munich. Golden, hazy body, with big, creamy, white head. Aroma of grain, hay, bread, citrus, herbs.
