Had this at Czechpoint in Malmö a couple of years ago, then again at Stockholm beer & Whiskey 2013. Its a good unfiltered beer and way surpass its own filtered twin, still though, dont get the hype..

The urquell served at their factory (Green beer as they call it) is simply amazing!!
the normal urquell is a top pilsen already but if you get the chance to visit their factory you will taste something really unique!!

I had this back in early November when the Kegs got sent around in the US, was saving the notes for a "milestone" rating, because Im lame like that. This milestone being my 2800th rating. 

Pours a nice hazy golden color with a great head and nice lacing on the glass, its a very nice looking glass of beer. 

The aroma is really something, doughy & yeasty. Its bright but only lightly fruity, its got some limestone, and a good wallop of herbal hoppy character. 

The flavor is mildly sweet but never overly so, its plenty hoppy in a grassy and herbal way and its got plenty of bitterness to balance things out. The malt character is very soft but at the same time ubiquitous and very identifiable. The finish is dry and clean. As the beer warms it shows some light honey and some faint fruitiness at moments, but thats sort of fleeting. 

This was not a cask from the wood experience at the brewery as I had always pictured my sampling of this beer would be, but this makes me want that experience all the more.
Thicket and tastier then a normal pilsner. Easy to drink. More bitterness. Would like to have this one again

Pilsner urquell unfiltered

I ended up having this one back to back with the regular pilsner urquell. The first bar I went to thought they had it, but it was the import version. I was lucky to find this on tap at Local Option. 
Pours a golden yellow with a white head. The first difference that I notice is the aroma. That is a big difference. This does remind me of fresh pilsners and helles I consumed in Europe. Sweet doughy malts. reminiscent of cotton candy. Some herbal saaz spice. The regular lacks this vibrancy in aroma flavor and mouthfeel. As it opens up the flavor difference is more apparent than my first sip. Sweet malts smooth malts that the yeast rounds out. Some herbal bitterness. Balanced and really tasty with a dry noble hop finish. A fuller and creamier mouth feel. This IS really good. Though the regular is decent, the unfiltered version is far superior. It would be hard to find a better pilsner. 
8/4/9/4/17

Tap at Earl of Essex. It pours a hazy orange body with a creamy white head. Aroma is malty with yeast and grassy hoppy notes. Flavour is sweet malt, bread and a clean, crisp bitterness from the hops. Dry and hoppy finish. Very enjoyable.

På fat @ Green Lion, Malmö. Guldfärgad, lätt dimmig, med ett stort vitt skum. Bröd, gräs, citronskal i både smak och doft. Trevlig beska. Men jag hittar inte riktigt allt det fantastiska som så många andra gör. En gid pilsner, men inte mycket mer än så.

Cask. From the barrel in the basement at Plzen. Ive lived in Prague for over a year now and finally made the trip. One of the absolute top destinations for a beer enthusiast. The undisputed pinnacle of the style and the beer responsible FOR the style. I asked the tour guide why they dont market this gear and she said it was because it was too expensive. Later I was knocking em back at Na Parkanu for 40 crowns a pint. Id say the two beers taste different. The one in the basement was yeastier and younger. Enhanced by the environment of course. Both shared a characteristic, rocky White head which seperates. Cloudy pale yellow. Went and saw Viktoria Plzen pump Pribram in the evening for Pavel Vrba s last ever match before he takes on the national job. Tanned a 1,5l PET bottle of the stuff on the train home at night as well. Magic.

Unfiltered, unpasteurised, served from wooden barrel. Very cloudy, pale blond appearance. Strong lacing with a bit of an uneven, lumpy head. Theres a touch of tartness in the aroma and lots of pale malts. Texture is very smooth and creamy with only a light carbonation. Flavour of pale malts. Theres a touch of wood there too. The bitterness is balanced, not particularly strong with hop. Woody dryness in the aftertaste. I tasted this from several different barrels and there were slight variations between them. Some were more tart, zesty and almost lactic compared to the others.

drank on tap at monks kettle. A: very floral. slight biscut and cracker, slight dry grass and mineral notes. very slight sulfur. A: light yellow with a billowy white head. slight haze but almost brite. T: awesome.Tangy floral hop, slight cracker malt note thats wiped clean with first a mineral note then a nice, not overpowering bitterness.P: light in body with a good level of carbonation, a refreshing dryness. O: maybe one of the best pilsners Ive ever had, Tons more flavor than the bottles or on tap. A whole diffrent beer
Huge keg @sbwf13. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma and taste is well balanced, malt, subtle hop notes and lots of yeast. I dont really understand the hype for this one

Bucket list beer! And I have this rating due to a tremendous friend. Thank you Kevin. This beer has the flavors of the PU we are all familiar with but its fresher, cleaner, more flavorful. Really a wonderful treat to taste this.

Tap at Maxs. Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing. Aroma is moderate Pils malt, light sweet corn notes, and light spicy hops. Flavor is malt forward with medium hops and bitterness with light DMS notes and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Tap at Max?s. Pours clear, bright gold with creamy white head and plenty of rising bubbles. Aroma is cereal and biscuit malts, light grassy notes, mixed herbs, light lemon zest, and some orange peel. Flavor is smooth, bready malts with good supporting light fruit esters and finishing dry with some subtle hop bitterness that blends in nicely. Medium body and carbonation.

22oz Pilsner Urquell mug on tap at Map Room with some of the filtered version side by side. Pours hazy amber-golden color with a cloud-like thick head. Definitely hazier compared to the regular Urquell. The beer is basically cracker and honey malt notes centric with a medium saaz hop character. The hops were milder than I anticipated. There was a light sulfur character but worked nicely in the beer. This character was much stronger on the filtered version and the filtered version definitely tasted stripped out of the all nuance that the malt character brings. The carbonation was a bit too sharp on this beer and I would love to try this on cask. It was a good beer, not as great as I hoped it would be, and I would definitely seek out the cask version.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: From a 170-L cask at Papago Brewing Co. Appearance is similar to the regular version, but slightly darker with a thin film for a head. Pungent aroma of pils malt, lots of honey, some alfalfa, and sweet grass. A light malty sweetness, like a honey-glazed biscuit, hits first on the taste, followed by pie dough, light caramel, a hint of pineapple and lemongrass, more honey, and a light, dry bitterness to finish. Like most pilsners, it goes down quite easily. Im glad I got to try this stateside.

Draft at Local Option in Chicago. Unfiltered gold with a creamy head. Smell is fresh noble hop and clean malt. Flavor is rich and bready, hints of toffee, diacetyl, creamy mouthfeel, slight hop bite. Epic beer and one of the best of the style as far as cleanliness and drinkablility goes.

On tap @ Papago Pilsner Urquell Founders Day Cask tapping event. 14 karat pour, almost a hazy honey-like appearance with an ivory foam. Light grassiness, lemon peel, biscuit, and yeast along with a mild spice. Flavor shows some green, leafy qualities, caramel malt, fresh dough, white pepper, damp hay, and citrusy hops. Flavor packed, remarkably flavorful for the style. Yeasty, spicy, hoppy...yum! Cant believe I had a chance to try this!

UPDATED: SEP 9, 2014 At Romans? pub. Hazy golden body with a super creamy tall starch white head. The aroma and flavor is clean and crisp. It is a very nice beer, and the gross buttery flavor usually present was not. While this beer is an excellent pilsner, it isn?t as good as the first batch of new glarus two women r&d beer. 2013. 7,4,7,4,16

On tap at the Miller employees pub. Much better than last time. I would order at a pub this if available regularly in the United States. Super good.

On cask at Papago Brewing Company Pilsner Urquell Founders Day tapping. Hazy golden pour. Aroma of soft hops, white pepper is very apparent. The flavor is mildly grassy with a yeasty character. Incredibly soft and smooth mouthfeel.

On draft from wooden cask at Papago for their Pilsner Urquell Founders Day Cask tapping event. Pours a slightly cloudy gold with a frothy white head. The nose has a lot of yeast, some oak and crisp grassy hops. Sweet malty flavor with some caramel, some light nutty oakiness and a long bitter hoppy grassy finish with a little spicy white pepper hint. Medium-bodied with a rounded silky mouth feel. Best pilsner Ive ever had and worthy of the hype.

On tap: The aroma consists of floral notes, light fruit, grass, and grain. Its a slightly hazy golden-orange with some wood floaties from the bottom of the barrel. It has a small white head that quickly settles to a thin film. The flavor starts with with a quick dose of light fruit, grain, and a hint of honey sweetness. It finishes light-moderately floral with some hints of grass and lemon. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, quite a tasty and sessionable Pilsner. A better tasting Pilsner does not come to mind.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2014 On tap at maproom next to filtered urquell. Pours hazy golden with white head, clearly unfiltered especially compared to the bright and clear regular urquell. Aroma has noble saaz hops, cracker and honey malt notes, nice grainy and malty aroma. Hop aroma is also much brighter in the unfiltered version. Flavors are rather assertive seemingly much more bitter than the regular version. Big saaz character throughout, very dry, peppery hop and yeast notes, Wow this is like night and day difference from the filtered version, much bigger malt profile, really grainy and grapey, with big saaz hop profile. Hard to believe its the same beer. On the very backnd the classic urquell character comes through more. The regular version is just so lifeless and dull by comparison. The mouthfeel is a bit fizzy, over carbed really, carbonation would probably be better from an oak cask (so I guess the search sorta continues). Ive been wanting this beer for several years and besides not being on the urquell cellar tour this doesnt disappoint. 4.0

6/5/14 cask at The Radler, sampled next to draft filtered version. This cask version is quite a bit better than the unfiltered draft i had before (see rating above) this just has tons of character, heart and soul. subtle oak brings a mild funk to it, nice full mouth feel, wonderful pilsner. 4.2
"Not that big deal, maradok a szűrt verziónál - amúgy így reggelire lecsúszik"

*** CZECH BEER # 800 *** draught at U sudu, Praha. Glad to find this here, obviously some kegs were released for the 170th anniversary of the brewery. Hazy golden colour, creamy white head, like beaten eggwhite. Lovely hoppy-malty nose, so very Bohemian. Intensive malty start with yeasty fruity hints and a touch of dusty cellar, also fresh apples. Good Saaz hops tune in at once, biter-sweet overall character. An unexpected treat!

On tap at the Urquell Norwegian roadshow.
Lots of grainy goodness, firm, discreet and just to the point bitterness. Soft, balanced, but not boring. Fruit and bitterness in the tail. Apricots, mango, grass.
Unfiltered version has more flavour and deeper character than regular version, definitely recommendable!

Hazy golden beer with enormous head. Poured from wooden keg at OlutExpo 2013. Aroma has butter, light grassy and floral hops and lots of malt. Taste has buttery malts and long after taste with grassy hop flavors. Damn good pils, hops and other flavors pop up way better than in the pasteurized version.

Lucky to find this one @ The Green Lion, Malmo. Hazy golden amber, not much head. Oily corn aroma. Biscuit resin corn malt flavour. Dry biscuit corn aftertaste. Decent big tasting lager but not as good as other ratings suggest.

Golden orange, slightly hazy with lots of white head. Aromas of malts, diacetyl and grass. Flavor is strong malty and crispy bitter. Mouthfeel is little thinner than medium and pretty carbonated. There is not a big difference to the filtered version. This is a little darker, and more intense on flavor and aroma, but at the same time less refreshing and drinkable.
Tap. Strong, excellent lager aroma. Malt, hops and yeast. Clean, grassy and some bread. Taste is close to perfection for a pilsner. Fresh and appetising bitterness, excellent balance.

Small wood cask at Bishops Arms, Malmö, Gustav Adolf TorgUnfiltered. Unpastorized.The last lucky glass of the wooden cask. Cloudy blond color with no real head, just a small foam collar. Very nice aroma, dry grass, malt, light rubber, light feet. Expectedly, its kinda low carbonated, good malt flavor, breadish character, grassy hops with a hay accent, fairly bitter. Penalized a bit by the lack of carbonation and Engish-cask temperature.
Excellent beer (but if you ask me, I prefer some German Hallertau Helles).

21/07 RBESG Grand Tasting, brought from Na Parkanu in a take away bottle. It poured only slightly hazy golden body with tiny head. Typical and nice Czech pils herbal aroma, some grain and a bit of malt. Flavor was a letdown, watery, quite sweet biscuit, only slightly bitter from these herbal hops. Thin body with low carbonation couldnt make particularly nice finish. Im aware that this was not in the best shape, obviously the best beers tend to deteriorate quicker, so will rerate it sometime, although Ill rate it now as it was.

Gravity straight from the wood at The Haggerston. Happy to get to try this. The pours a hazy medium amber with a thick, creamy, luxurious head. You could rest a quarter on this beer and it wouldnt sink. The nose is quite bready. Savory yeast notes. Mild honeycomb, wax. Pollen. The taste is more Bready sweetness. Donut. Honeyed pear. Full of vitality. Theres a strong mineral quality to the beer. The texture is lush. Wonderfully crisp while maintaining a creamy mouthfeel. Overall, awesome stuff. I could drink this every day.

On tap in Prague. Pours hazy gold with a very creamy white head. Aroma of light malt, a little bit of bread, yeast and honey as well, no off notes (sulfur, etc). Taste of light malt, slight honey, slight vegetal, medium body with a surprisingly light hop touch for a pilsner- but this is pretty much perfectly balanced. Possibly the best lager Ive had.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2013 Gravity cask at the Prince Regent - Marylebone, London. Pours lightly hazy gold with a very large, tight white froth. The aroma has bright and bready pale malts, crispy cereal, hay. Light to medium sweet flavor with a very intense breadiness, some dry hay, rich cereal. Light bodied with fine, massaging carbonation. Quick and somewhat dry to finish with plenty more semi-dry bread, some dough, cereal grains, mild hay bittterness. Exceptional. (4.2)Had it again, the next day, at the Haggerston. Even better. A little less bready, a little crisper, a little less toasted corn. Delicious and even more refreshing. (4.3)
Draught (EBBC 2013, Edinburgh) - Hazy golden in colour. Lime, malt, grain and a hint of soap in the aroma. Hoppy, malty and zingy taste with notes of lemon, lime, tea and earthy hops.

Thanks to Ryan for lugging this from Czech Republic. Slightly hazed golden orange pour with a nice white head. Slight skunk on the nose, but otherwise sweet bread, apple, toast, and biscuit. A touch of floral hops and yeast. The flavor is a lot like Kings Hawaiian Rolls. Sweet and bready, some biscuit, floral hops, and apple. Very easy drinking.
Pils on tap thanks to recent beer tasting, overall pretty straight forward, smooth, easy to drink, still fresh from the cross continent journey, yum.

PET Growler 48 hours old thanks to Mowbeer! Pours a low haze glowing, bright golden. Medium, dense white foam with soapy lacing. Nose is heavily skunky up front, moves to some orange sticky fruits and a lot of sweet honey roll. Taste is not really bitter or even what I would consider pilsner-like as it brings soft Hawaiian sweet roll, a lot of corn surprisingly, biscuit, and someone was mentioning "toasted corn" which I can see. Interesting, but certainly not hoppy or sharply biting like an agressive pilsner. Palate is aerated with some oil density. In the finish there is some rich caramel and flan dessert. Reminds me more of a prohibition lager of sorts that I would expect from Jacks Abby than a pilsner in any sense. Still, loving the palate and the character even if all around the flavor caught me off guard. (also note that I was instructed to take "big swigs" of this beer via MJ, which I did) Wife gave this a 3.5.

On tap at Lokal in Prague, but also all over the city. Sometimes you wonder if these regional treats are going to live up to the hype. How good can a traditional, unfiltered, unpasteurized Czech style Pils really be? The answer is very simple: really fucking good. Pours a slightly hazy, deep gold with some extremely frothy, creamy, lacing white head. Honestly, it looks like perfection. The nose is very nice too, malt, dried crackers, mild honey, almost like white toast with honey spread over, a little light brie rind lurking, some mild lemon. Flavor is just spot on, gently toasted white bread, some biscuit with honey, lemon, some grass, a little straw. The finish is really the icing on the cake, its clean and creamy at the same time. Utterly refreshing and drinkable. An icon of the style. Worthy of all of the praise and more.

UPDATED: OCT 6, 2013 Fattat först nu i efterhand att den här ölen som bjöds på bryggeribesöket inte är samma som den vanliga urquell. Det var någonstans i samband med den här ölen jag började få upp ögonen för god öl. Året var 2002 på en resa i Europa med boysen. Ett legendariskt citat från detta bryggbesök: 
-so dear visitors, do you know how we brew the dark beer? We brew it in the night.
Kan man garva lite åt än idag...


På SBWF 2013. Underbar. Dock låg i smörkolan

Lost the tasting notes. Had it in 2012 in the cellars in Pilsen. Asked for another pour, and another, and another. I can totally believe this is the standard for pilsener, and my heart was bleeding knowing what other breweries dare to call pilsener beer.

Nefiltrovany Pilsner Urquell is a billion times better than the bottle.  It really is unbelievable if you are having it on tank (tankova) in Prague.  There is a growing  number of establishments that pour it straight from the polystyrene bags through the tap to your glass.  It doesnt get better than Pilsner from the tank in Prague 6.

Direct from the barrel in the Pilsner Urquell brewery. Hazy golden in colour with a creamy white head. The taste is unique, unlike anything I have had before, Creamy on the palat with a slight sour note and a hint of yeast. A fantastic refreshing after taste. Beyond all expectation!

Hazy orange golden color, small white to off-white head. Smell malts, (Dutch) bouillon-soep and really different from regular pilseners. Taste malts, lightly bitter, a bit grainy but nicely balanced. Low to medium body, medium carbonation.

Bottle @ Café Oud Brabant thx to Joes. He somehow arranged a bottle of this, even though its highly unusual. Hazy yellow to golden colour, big soft white head. Smells malts, some soup, yoghurt. Tastes malty, fresh, bitter. Thin body, fine carbo.

Draught @ brewery tour (straight from the fermentation barrell). Nice yellow colour, nice head. All the original taste left, non-pasteurized, non-filtered, not moved an inch from the place of birth. Yes, this is indeed the original pilsner, not the more widespread product of the modern brewing process. Very easy to drink, but the hops are still there.

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2013 Allright, now that Ive had it both in the brewery cellars and upstairs, the latter in copious amounts, I can attest that first, the one straight from the barrel tastes different. Significantly more yeasty, almost sulphury. Second, now I can attest for the drinkability of the unfiltered Urquell that is draught at Na Spilku and Na Parkanu, plus occacionally at other spots. The drinkability is unsurpassed. I was drinking one beer all the time almost all day and never got tired with it. Try to beat that!
Original rating: Hazy golden, lasting head. Aroma of straw and bready malt, combined with lots of lovely Saaz hoppiness (herbal, grassy, hay, some lemon), bound together by a subtle yeastiness. Full malty body, a light yeasty tartness and even some salty hints, with a moderately strong bitterness and a bready-herbal aftertaste. Shy hints of diacetyl and honey. Now thats what I call a noble pils. Absolutely fantastic!
Heller getreidiger Antrunk, runde Hopfennoten, angenehme mittelstarke Bitterkeit. Süffig, frisch, ohne Fehler. 11/11/12/12//11

Grifo. Saboreada en oct´12. Brota con color dorado pálido en mi vaso Tumbler con apariencia velada. Corona persistente, tupida y cremosa de espuma blanca. Copiosos anillos y encajes en las paredes. Aromas florales intensos redondeados por matices de hierba fresca y heno. El sabor presenta amargor cítrico con sutil malteado y astringencia de piel de limón. Cuerpo ligero y carbonatación suave. Textura cremosa y sensación amarga limpia. Final seco y refrescante con notas de madera fresca. Olvídate de tus experiencias con Urquell y prueba esta Obra Maestra!!!
On tap. Enjoyed on oct´12. Pours bright golden yellow into my Tumbler glass. Veiled appearance. Very close & creamy lasting crown made of white froth. Copious rings & collars on sides. Strong floral aroma rounded by fresh grass & hay hues. Flavor profile hands citric bitterness, subtle maltiness as well as lemon zest astringency. Light body & soft carbonation. Creamy texture & clean bitter sensation. Dry & crispy finish. Fresh wood notes. Forget what you´ve experienced before with Urquell. Try this masterpiece!!

The king of pilsners. My rating is based on the pilsner urquell I had straight from the wooden barrels in the cellars of the Pilsner urquell brewery in Plzen, Czech Republic in 11/2012. Unfiltered, unpasteurized, creamy head, hoppy aroma and taste, malty palete, golden color, refreshing! The one and only plsner ever!

#15
Zweifellos ein Pils der Spitzenklasse! Weiß zu überzeugen und damit sind die Hopfen-Jünger ebenso gemeint wie die Anhänger malziger Biere Pilsener Brauart! Die Tatsache, dass hier etwas Hefe im Bier ist steigert die Vollmundigkeit enorm. Wanderer kommst du nach Pilsen, besichtige die Brauerei und genieße die Einmaligkeit dieser Spezialität!
	
Test vom 25.3.2006 	Noten: 15,14,14,14,15,14 - 14,15

On tap at the Pilsner Urquell brewery tour. Best pilsen i ever had. Nice saaz hop aromas, some sweet, diacetil ones. Pours hazy golden, with huge creamy white head. Light body, average carbonation. Taste is smooth, malty, sweet, full, and overall delicious. A pitty it cannot be tasted in some other places!!

Tap @Vltava, Helsinki. Poured cloudy, golden with a frothy, creamy lasting white head. Grassy, earthy, hoppy aroma. Flavor is grassy hoppy, yeasty and malty. Some light harshness in the finish. Smooth, creamy, superb mouthfeel. Almost lives up to the hype, wow!

Draught at Metro, Lahti. Slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Malt and grass in the aroma. Flavor is grassy hops, malt, butter and nice bitterness. Quite smooth and medium bodied. Finish is dry and bitter. Very tasty and balanced pilsener.
Immagino che quella assaggiata qui sia solo lombra della pilsner che si beve là. La versione non filtrata è forse troppo delicata per affrontare un viaggio fin qui.
0,5 l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours clear golden with a high head. Aroma is sweet malts and some fruits. Flavor is malts, fruits and some hops. Very nice, better than original.
UPDATED: OCT 30, 2015 On tap @ Vihreä HaltiatarPours hazy yellow with medium head. Aroma is grain, sweet malts. Flavor is sweetish. Malts, grain and hint of cream. Nice!
UPDATED: AUG 9, 2013 From the barrel at urquell brewery, pilsen. Hazy golden color with white head. Fresh malty aroma, hops, fruits, cask. Nice malty, hoppy taste, yest, wood, hops.
Long lasting white head, golden colour(candlelight). Aroma is good but not spectacular. Taste is a perfect balance with malts and traditional lager hops. Medium aftertaste dry/bitterness.
Draught @ Opus K, Lohja. Bit hazy golden with a small head. Aroma is butter, malt, grassy hops. Flavor malty, butter, hops. Real gem.
Draught at Punavuoren Ahven, Helsinki. Colour is hazy golden with thick white head. Aromas and flavours are malts, grain, spices and some hoppiness. Fabulous.

Draught. Golden yellow, hazy. Nose has soft malts, some corn. Subtle hops. A touch of yeast. A bit grainy after a while. Body is rich and soft, medium light bodied. Really enjoyable to drink. Soft, pleasant. A bit dry in the finish. Some hop harshness as well.-- bb/h

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2013 Draught@ Hospoda Korbel, Seinäjoki as "Unfiltered Pilsner Urquell"
Quite clear and pale for an unfiltered pils. Aroma has grassy hops, some butter and grainy malt. Flavour is rather grassy with hops and grainy malt. Dry finish. Feels a bit sticky. Smooth, easy to drink and lacks the lager harshness completely. Better than the filtered version (no surprises here) but somehow I expected more.
Wooden keg @ Olutexpo 2013
Aroma has grassy notes, some butter and grain. Flavour has butter, grass and overwhelming grainy tones. Also some herbs and yeasty notes. Still good, but not worth the queueing and hype. Harsh score estimate: 3.3.

(Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki) Slightly hazy golden with a small, creamy and lacy head. Buttery nose with grassy-herby hops. Flavor is smoothly malty with herby hops, lots of diacetyl and a long, dry and bitter finish. Very full body for the ABV, soft CO2. A really enjoyable and balanced - even complex pils. Much smoother than the regular Urquell. 4435
091112. Tap at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours hazy golden with a medium head. Aroma butter, grass. Slightly buttery sweet taste. Not Bad.

Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours a cloudy golden colour with a white head. Aroma of grassy hops, grains and some citrus. Flavour of grainy malts, strong grassy hops, butter and herbs. Medium bodied, slick mouthfeel and a long bitter, buttery finish. Refreshing. Great stuff.

Draught @ Tuulensuu, Tampere.
Pours hazy golden color with a large frothy head. Aroma of fruits, grass, hops and faint butter. Flavour of grass, mild malts, butter and hay. Quite nice.
3515

Draught at Blackdoor, Helsinki. Poured clear golden in color with a fluffy white head. Hay, butter, grainy, some mild grassy hops in aroma but also some yeast and dough on the nose and a bit of suffocated cheese-aroma appears. Leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Dry, medium body. Grassy and malty bready in taste. Quite malty aftertaste with some mild grassy hops and some sweetness as well.

Draught @ Hilpeä Hauki, Helsinki

Pours clear golden with a massive smooth white head. Aroma of grassy hops, grainy malts and hints of fruits. Taste is nicely grassy and smoothly hoppy with some mild buttery and grainy malty notes. Finish is bitter and grassy with some malty notes. Nice, extremely well balanced pilsener.

Draught at Black Door, Helsinki. Cloudy golden yellow with a thick creamy head. Grassy, buttery aroma with grain and malt. Very malty flavour with butter and butterscotch, grassy and bitter hops and some grain. Bitter, dry, hoppy finish. Probably the best pilsener Ive ever tasted.

(Draught at Hilpeä Hauki, production date 31.10.2012, 20121108) The beer poured golden and cloudy. Its head was medium size and white. Aroma had grass, fruitiness, grain and malts. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were grass, grain, fruitiness, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Afteraste was hoppy, fruity and bitter. A very balanced and pleasant aroma and taste. Why do they sell the filtered version at all?
UPDATED: OCT 31, 2012 From wood cask @ The Rover. Hazy pale golden with a small white head. Grassy and fruity notes. Malt, grass, fruit and hops.  Medium body with a wonderful balanced finish.
Draught at a PR event at Porter and Sons, Tel Aviv. Pours clear, greenish, golden, with a nice big white head. Grain, toasty aroma, bitter, fresh taste. Long finish, light body. Great beer.
A bit hazy Golden colour with a creamy white head. Aroma of Saaz and diacetyl with some sweet biscuit. Unpasteurized version tasted in Sweden, Ufh, Perfect

Smakprov på SBWF12. Gullengul mycket lätt beslöjad öl med ett vitt klassiskt kraftigt Urquell-skum. Skillnaden mot vanlig Urquell är att denna känns lite stramare och torrare. Liste jästsmak och något mindre av smörkolan.
Drucken opasteuriserad på czechpoint i Malmö. Lätt grumlig. Stor doft av vetebröd, jäst och blommor. Fruktig, jästig, massor av säd, järnsmak och rund markerad beska. Fantastisk god.

Draught at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival. Cloudy, light golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of floral/noble hops, sulphur, lager yeast, grain and biscuit. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of biscuit, grain and floral hops. Medium bodied with low to medium carbonation. Better than the regular one.

Hazy golden body with a thick white head. Grassy and slightly citrus aroma. Taste is malty, some bread, hints of cheese like if its a german kellerbier. Dry grassy finish. Hoppier than the normal Urquell.

From the vats in the brewery cellar.
Pours a deep, cloudy straw, with a firm white head.
Spicy, malty aroma, citrus, hops, yeast, bread.
Dry, light to medium bodied, medium bitterness, creamy CO2.
Malty, spicy taste, yeast, caramel, wood (?), citrus, diacetyl, hops.
Supremely easy drinking, with fantastic balance. (2012-09-12)
Wooden barrel @ SBWF12. Cloudy golden colour. Dry, hoppy, bread and yest with a bitter finish.

From wooden barrel at the brewery tour into the plastic cup. Pours cloudy golden color with amazing creamy head. Aroma is sweet malty and yeast. Taste is malt, yeast, hops, a lot more bitter than regular PU. Really great pilsner, but Im not sure if it quite lives up to its hype.

Drafted at the beer museum in Pilsen..Ive had this beer dozens of times,its the kind of beer that will put a smile on your face no matter how shitty your day has been..Theres a lot to be said about this brew but nothing that hasnt already been said in the other ratings...Pours hazy with a honey golden color,the head is pillowy white with an amazing texture and flavor...This is the kind of beer that having one just isnt enough,no matter how much of a hurry youre in...The flavor you get from the hops are fruity,spicy and of course hoppy :) Writing about this makes me crave a nice tall,ice cold glass of one right now...I consider myself lucky to be living in the only city in the world that has it available every single day...If youve had the opportunity of trying this,then you know of what I speak...

Straight from the barrel on the brewery tour.  Thick mouth with a yeasty after taste.  Almost has an imperial pilsener taste to it.  Much more complex than the usual.  Cloudy with a nice single finger head.  This was tasty.

Tap @ Na Parkanu, Pilsen. Pours slightly hazy golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma of rich bready malt, yeasty, white bread, loads of Czech grassy and flowery hops. Flavor is rich malt, white bread, yeast, grassy flowery hops. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter refreshing finish, super drinkability. A pure master piece of a beer, havent i been driving ill been seated the whole day quaffing this !

Hand bottle @ RBESG Grand Tasting 2012. Cuso/Imro generously provided a hand bottle at the tasting but it tasted a bit off, so Im going to rate based on my previous experience with the beer during my previous trip to the brewery in Pilsen. A bit hazy, golden appearance with a white head. A bit chewy, bready yeasty, lightly fruity (lemon), straw aroma. Nice, light fruity, a touch spicy, yeasty/bready, hay flavor. The highlight of my last trip to the Czech Republic and really an eye opening experience to unfiltered lagers for me.

On tap at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Hazy golden colour, big fluffy white head. Aroma is floral, lemon, soft sweet malts, inviting. Flavour is malty, soft sweet, floral, light yeasty, grainy, quite bitter grainy and malty finish. Light-bodied, soft mouthfeel. Really nice pils, although I dont really dig the grainy bitterness. They sell plastic 1.5L bottles there now, straight from the tap.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2012 Bottle, RBESG 2012 grand tasting. Lightly hazy golden colour. Aroma bread, hops, a small bit yeasty. Taste medium to light heavy bitter, light sweet. Dry and hoppy, bitter finish. Might have got impacted by the bottle a little. 7 4 7 3 14 
RERATE 15.11.2012
Tap from barrel at historical Urquells cellar. Aroma yeasty, pils malt, very fresh. Taste was evidently yeasty, light acidic acidic, medium hoppy bitter, light malty. Harmonic, yet the yeast gives a noticeable acidic twist. The pils essence, urquell.
RBESG  tasting. Golden colored beer. Yeast and malt in aroma. Taste, bitter hops, malt. Good.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2013 Great mild carbonation, super easy drinkable. Herbs, grass fields, light malty, some yeast. Mild bitter start, herbs. Full bitterness from there on. (Lazy rating because we drank it in Pilzn driectly and were too busy, well, dirnking...)
Tap @ Na Parkanu, Plzen. Hazy golden color with a cloudy white head. Aroma is lemon, yeast and orange. Balanced taste of hops and citrus. Lightly bitter. Smooth and a little oily feel.

[keg at Anthonys, Leeds EBBC12] Rare UK tapping of unfiltered cask PU, served by the thirsty brewmaster himself. Opaque golden beer with a large, puffy white head. Soft bready aroma, slightly floral on the nose. Really smooth on the palate, the slightly bitter edge of the regular PU has been totally mellowed away. There is a gentle bitterness there, but its really only in the background. Supremely easy to drink, I wish they sold this over here, Id buy it all the time! [19052012]

toast, caramel, barnyard, herbs, citrus, soy sauce, ginger, cooked vegetables, licorice, vanilla, golden, cloudy, white foam, rocky head, tan foam, light sweetness, very bitter, heavily sour, salty, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,
golden, amber, hazy, white foam, medium bitterness, lightly sour, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter,

It is well worth while to travel to Plzen just to have this beer.  It is ingredibly wide spectrum taste with butterscotch, chocolate, floral, and herbs.  The triple hop bitterness is hidden but comes alive in the after taste.

Golden color with a big white head. Plenty of lacing. Nice crisp malt and hop aroma with a hint of yeast. Dry flavor of malt and yeast. Very good, but not as crisp as the regular version. But I wont pass it up.
The first, so for me its still the best. Her Josef Groll really made the difference adding Saas hops.

Draught from a keg from the Czech Republic.   This is the only beer my wife will drink, she buys it from an importer who gets it from Plzen.  After a carboy I can see why.  Notes of grass, hay and grape.  Big bodied for such a light seeming beer. Perfectly balanced, in the malt and hops.  To quote her again. "This is the best beer in the world, why should I drink anything less."  Wonderful finish.  A good reason to retire to Plzen

(Actually she also drinks the tinned tankovna Pilsner Urquell, but nothing else".)
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text:
Draught at Den Blå Hund.
Cloudy amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of ay, grass and hops.
Malty flavour of hay, hops and grass with notes of grape fruits and yeast.
Hoppy finish.

Sample from the brewery.  ORange yellow pour with a fluffy white head.  Light caramel and bread aroma.  Very sharp bitter flavor.  Notes of citrus.  Bready with some dusty funk.  Crisp and biting.  Excellent pils.

From the vaulted lagering cellar in Plzen, this was the third time i travelled to Plzen to taste this wonderful brew. After an hour and more, boring trip, the guide was most proud of the bottling plant(greatest in Europe) My son and me was more interested in the beer. Served as fresh as fresh can be, in a big plastic cup, the color is hazy golden with a big creamy white head. The aroma has lots of fresh yeast, citrus and spices from the noble Saaz. Taste is overwhelmingly fresh hops, very good hop presence, spicy and grassy, on top of a solid sweet malty body. This is good++

(Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival, 30 Sep 2011) Hazy golden colour with frothy, white head. Malty nose with notes of grass, hay, bready malt and hints of citrus. Malty, fresh taste with grass, bread, hay, toffee, hints of citrus and a generous grassy bitterness in the finish. Medium body, fairly dry. Very fresh and very tasty. Lovely pilsener.

Fat på ölmässan i Stockholm 2011
Vertikalprovad mot den filtrerade versionen. Ofiltrerad är mycket mer fruktig än den brödiga filtrerade versionen. Trevlig eftersmak.
UPDATED: JUL 20, 2012 Sampled at SB & WF 2011. Golden with a small white head. Smells stale and malty. Tastes stale malty with a stale bitter finish.

Sample @ Stockholm Beer & Whiskey Festival
Very nice lager with great mouthfeel, the only funky part of it is that its taste like nachos, but in a good way. Its a beer i would like to have more often than having a sample in a stressful festival.

Sample @ SBWF on September 29. Pours cloudy yellow with a rather small white head. Smell reminds me of a hefeweissen. Theres yeast, coriander and a fresh sweetness. Taste is malty with hints of butterscotch. It has a nice and balanced hoppy bitterness to it. A great lager. Pity this isnt the Urquell thats widely distributed.

Draught from the cask at the brewery tour:
Big vast white head on top of a deep hazy yellow colored beer.
Smell wild yeast, light sour, yeast, bit like champagne, hints of hops.
Taste is a soft smooth balanced mix of hops, yeast, smooth bitterness, a slight hint of something acidic/sour, some herbs/spices but smooth.
Light fruity yeasty bitter aftertaste.
Low carbo, medium to a bit fuller body, soft mouthfeel and a creamy texture.
Had this again in Na Parkanu but you could taste it was less fresher.
Best is directly from the cask. Divine!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text:
tap straight from oak cask on brewery tour.    calm bright orange pour with a large frothy white head.   aroma of bright lemon kissed dough with a pleasant musty basement funk.  almost berlinerweisselike nose.   quite enjoyable old wood rustic wort character.   low carbonation.  awesome. complex.  beautifully made.    complex, clean, rustic lemon grass, citrus layored with dry musty cellar cobweb funk.   beautiful old barrel character for kicks.    yeast character somewhat reminicent of RR temptation.   but overall, quite the unique, well made, awesome beer.  would love to see more beers like this, if possible.    10.5.9.4.18



unfiltered tap offering at na parkanu, though not from the oak barrel.     missing oaky citrus, lemon of barrel version.  more creamy, dry doughy grassy bread.   more carbonation than wood version.  more doughy.  better mouthfeel.  thicker.   858517

  
nod to the wood barrel brewery tour version, though both are excellent.

This is still my favorite Bohemian style pilsner as of 6-5-11.  It pours golden yellow with a nice and foamy yellow head.  It smells of citrus, malt, hops, and floral.  It tastes fresh with a good balance of bitterness and malt sweetness.  The hop bitterness is the primary flavor and is very refreshing.  This is the oldest pilsner in the world and pilsner is named for the town, Pilz, it is brewed in.  I love this beer alot.  It is smooth and thin on the palaette and is good on a hot day or to complement good foods.

Draft @ SBWF 2010. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a sweetish bready grainy heral grassy hoppy aroma. Sweetish malty grainy bready grassy hoppy flavor. Has a sweetish malty grainy finish with some herbal grassy hops in the aftertaste.

Direct from the barrel at the brewery (and also on tap at Na Parkanu). Pours cloudy amber with a very large foamy white head. Nose; malt, bread, yeast, hay, farmyard. Taste; smooth velvety mouth-feel, lemon, orange, hay, bread, crisp, with a long refreshing bitter finish. Surely the best of its style.

Draught at Stockholm Beer and Whisky Festival 2010, thanks ompher! Hazy golden color. Sweet honeyish malt aroma with grassy hops and toffee. Fresh malty and bitter flavor with herbal, grassy and peppery hops. Slightly astringent mouthfeel. Very tasty fresh malt and hop profile.

Sampled at SBWF-10
Hazy golden. Medium white head.
Bready and malty in both aroma and flavour. Fine bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2014 Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. One of rather few places in Sweden with a licence to serve this beer unfiltered. Hazy golden beer with a very nice lasting offwhite head. Malty biscuit aroma, grassy, hoppy, citrus, bready, lovely malt base, citrus, cereal notes, floral, some spicy notes. Hoppy flavor, grassy, cereal, hay, biscuits, bready, some perfume. Hugely drinkable.

Old rating, SBWF 2010. (7/4/7/4/14) Somewhat hazy golden color, white head. Bready aroma, malty, mild spices, grassy and with metal notes. Bready hoppy flavor, grassy, metal notes, dough notes. Perfume finish along with some bread. Really nice pilsner but not as good as its reputation.

Draught sample at SBWF.

Very thirstquenching.
Orange cest bitternest and raw barleyl.
Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival:Pours a golden, hazy colour with a large head. Creamy, buttery aroma. Well balanced, lingering herbal bitterness. Somewhat thin mouth feel.

Draught @ SBWF 10. Hazy golden/yellow with a white head. Sweet, malty, caramel aroma. Very malty taste with a lot of bread/dough and yeast, also buttery. A gentle bitterness but more than the filtered one.

Draught at SBWF 2010. It poured a hazy golden liquid with a medium sized white head. A very fresh beer that was also fairly mild. Nice balance on the flavours and a kind of beer you could drink big 1-2 litre glasses of. But it was a bit to mild for my preference, wanted more of everything. However it was an experience to try and highly recomended.

On tap at SBWF.

What an pleasure to drink this beer. Hazy brownish with a large white head. 

Clean and fresh, and incredibly refreshing. Grass, fruit, malt, citrus, yeast and some bread.

I wonder if I ever want to drink the ordinary P U again?

UPDATED: AUG 4, 2013 Sample @ SBWF. Pours golden. Very hazy. This must be one of the most refreshing beers ever! Very fruity, apple. Clean maltiness. Citrusy hops. Caramel. Nice refreshing bitterness.
Full glass at SBWF.In short: Pale, cloudy, yeasty, floral, grass, bread, dough. Easy drink would work good with food. Medium body, slick feel, soft carbonation. This is good stuff!

15 cl sample at SBWF 2010, first time this beer is outside the Czech Republic. And what a beer it is! Beautiful in the glass with a cloudy pale straw color and a big rocky white head. The flavours are so fresh and crisp, yet smooth. The Saaz hops are just lovely in this beer. I could drink liters upon liters of this. The normal PU is miles away from this.
The best beer ever, I like this. You should taste it.

Direct from the barrel at the brewery in Plzen. Malt barley, cereal and hops aroma, very fresh. Golden hazy colour with a frothy white head. Typical czech medium bitterness and balanced with very light sweetness in the taste toguether with malts and some far spices. Extremely refreshing and drinkable. I wish I can drink this beer one more time before I die. Superb! (Taste notes from 2005).

From the barrel in the brewery caves. 
Deep orange-gold, and a tight head that goes quickly to lace. Big saaz aroma, bready malts, cereals, and estery fruits like banana and orange that came out as it warmed. Wonderful flavor of bready malt, saaz, estery fruit: peaches, banana, orange. Slight tartness, with a great hop bitterness that isnt overdone. Wonderfully smooth and full with low carbonation. Great stuff. Eye-opening.
chiara buona schiuma persistente naso erbaceo leggermente maltato in bocca malto delicato luppolo fresco leggero citrico
Bevuta al Na Parkanu di Plzen, versione non filtrata e non pastorizzata, ancora più buona e saporita
This non-filtred Pilsner Urquell is the origin Pilsner Urquell. No exception, nice bitter and only i little bit sleepy. It is a pitty, that Pilsner Urquell in another pubs is so different.

Plastic 12oz glass at the end of the long, but worth it brewery tour, on a hot sunny day. Cloudy, beautiful golden pour over which lasts a large, typical Czech white mountain. The immediate impression is of freshness, fresh barley and bread. These softest malts feel almost doughy. Very cerealic while hosting a surprising amount of Saaz or its just a derivative of the freshness. It makes for a spicy, flowery, elegant bouquet. Round palate from its fresh, full active yeastiness. Very soft carbonation. Despite the roundness, it remains on the dry side. While its reputation may be slightly overstated due to its mythical rarity, it stays a worthy candidate as the only pils that has the slightest chance to remain rated above 4. In my book, Id call it a likely top 10 Czech pils.
You can drink it at any moment. One of my favorite beer from Czech Republic. I have tried the original brew in Plizen. It was really smooth and mellow with a hoppy flavor.

Tasted at the brewery down in the cellar of Urquell. The aroma is hoppy with notes of malt. Nice head. The flavor is hoppy too, but with a nice malty profile too it ends with a nice bitterness. Never have I had a beer in such an exciting environment!

Rating # 3700. Had this several times at both U Rudolfina, Na Spilze, U Parlamentj, Na Parkanu and direct from the barrel at the brewery. Actually I came to like the tank versions a bit better. It pours hazy golden with a fine lasting creamy egg white head and lacings. Amazing nose and taste. A bit of butter, buiscuit and yeast and lots of fresh, floral and grassy hops. Hoppy, dry and crisp. The palate is smooth. Very tasty and quaffable.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2011 Tap at Na Parkanu.  Strong barley malt and yeast aroma.  Cloudy amber color with giant off-white head.  Yeasty barley malt flavor with a strong dry grass hops finish.  Everything thats great about Pilsner Urquell coupled with everything thats great about an unfiltered beer - glorious.  If only I could have this every day.  From Brewery tour - Honey barley malt and hops aroma.  Cloudy golden yellow with large head.  Honey barley malt with moderate Saaz hops flavor.  Light carbonation.   So great.

Sampled both at Na Parkane and from a wodden barrel in the cellar of the brewery. This rating is based on the wooden barrel version. Great laceworks from a dense three-finger, foamy blond head. Body is hazy, shiny golden with an orangey hue.  A fresh yeasty scent up front, followed by a crisp sourish-dry, grainy malt aroma, with delicate, grassy hops and a faint citrus-fruity note. Strong malt body, considering the relatively low abv. Fresh and sour-sweet. A fine, floral and grassy hop bitterness lingers all the way to the finish. Notes of fresh yeast, wood and citrus. Mouthfeel is crisp and vivid, and a suitable cellary rawness makes it extremely drinkable. Finishes on the dry side, with lingering hops and malts. Awesome beer, and a great experience tasting it from the source.

From wooden tanks at brewery and on tap at Na Parkanu. Pours a nice slightly hazed golden color with a foamy white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, hops and a little bit of earthiness. The yeast stands out in this beer and melds with the bitteer saaz hops and malt to form a well balanced pils. Light fruitiness is apparent as well. Nice creamy mouthfeel and finishes easy and crisp.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2009 Draught at Na Parkane. A cloudy light gold with a large and airy foam head. A slightly sweet malt and yeast aroma. Citrus sweetness, combined with a yeasty dryness. Bittersweet and very moreish.

Small creamy head, red-brown color. Sweez aroma, candies, molasse and fruits. Flavor is very malty, quite roasty, caramel but few sweetness. Some ester, plums but not too intensive. Quite alcoholic finish, herbal, light to medium bitter hop notes. Light bitter aftertaste. Pleasant, complex brew.
Unfiltered, unpasteurized from the tap in Pilzen at Na Parkanu...lost for words.

(At Pivovarsky Klub) Standard lager colored with little white head, cloudy appearance. Hopped basic urquell aroma with flowery tones. Medium bodied. Flavor in start is similar for normal one, with flowers and hops, aftertaste lasts as bitter one and as slightly yeasty. Well, I am disappointed to this one, due to rather high expectations.

Tap at pivovarsky Klub. Poured clear golden body with a good looking foamy white hhead. Rich aroma of bottom fermentation yeast and floral hop. Smooth mouthfeel with tha flavor of pale malt, sourish and fine yeast, floral ho[p. Dry aftertaste. Fine but i expected more about that famous unfiltered beer...

Draught at U Pinkasu, pours light gold, tall frothy white head.  Nose is light and floral.  Very full bodied malt flavors with a lovely soft sazz bitterness.  More mellowed in the finish than the bottled.  Very refreshing pilsner.
Drunk this in the brewery on a tour. Golden body and a foamy white head. Delicious pilsner. Probably THE pilsener.
Draught Na Parkanu. Hazy orange colour. Big stable creamy white head. The flavour is very refreshing, fruity with a medium bitterness. Grapey fruity hop flavour. Very drinkable and good.

UPDATED: APR 16, 2009 This may just be the worlds best beer. Unfortunately youll have to go all the way to Plzen to get some, as it is only available at the end of a Pilsner Urquell brewery tour or in the Na Parkanu Restaurant at the brewery museum. I would suggest, however, that it is well worth the trip. I had it at the end of the tour, in the brewery cellars, on tap, straight from an oak barrel, surely the best way invented to drink beer. Unfortunately they only give you a very small glass, because this stuff is fantastic! The yeast present gives it a cloudy gold appearance, and it pours with quite a large, firm head. Its bitterness is mild, and dominated by the strong, fruity flavour. The palate is nice and crisp, and it finishes smoothly. An almost completely faultless beer. It is simply a brilliant, shining example of what beer can be!

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma of malt, yeast and grassy saaz hop notes. Flavour is sweet malt, bread and a clean, crisp bitterness from the hops. Dry and hoppy finish. A remarkable beer.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2009 (draught, at Na Parkanu, Pilsen) pours a hazy golden colour with a tall layer of dense white foam. distinct aroma of buttery, honeyed pale malts and herbal hops, more mellow and grainy than the standard version. flavour is more pronounced, with full honeyed pale malts and herbal hops, light notes of yeast and caramel. a full-bodied pilsner with medium carbonation and a smooth, light bitter finish.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2008 On tap at Urquell. Hazy golden with a tall. dense and creamy head leaving laces. Very malty aroma with a whiff of yeast. Medium body, sweet maltiness with lots of flowery hop accents. Dry and hoppy finish with the hops really growing on your palate. 270608 and 280608.

On draught on tour at the brewery. A hazy golden colored beer, with a beautiful white thick head. The aroma of hops, malt and some wood. The taste of hop bitters, a little bit sweet with malty and wood notes. Drink it slowly, the temperature rises and it will be more tastefull. It has a lovely dry bitter aftertaste.

En fût. Verre dégusté directement dans les souterrains de la brasserie. Arôme: Odeur de leveure et d’agrumes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence d’un moyen col mousseux et d’une fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût d’agrume et de boisé. Durée moyenne de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Faible effervescence en bouche. Présence d’agrume et de céréale en arrière goût. (Rating #1967)
Cloudy golden with medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma with yeasty, hoppy, floral and caramel notes. Sweet fruity, flavor with caramel and hoppy notes.

[I don’t need to say where I got this]
Plenty of fresh czech hops in the nose together with a citrusy sulfur.  Hazy caramel with a lasting clingy white foam.  Excellent caramel maltiness behind a fairly assertive bitterness that seems to be more rounded in the filtered version.  Tons of fresh hops flavour, but also fermentation sulfur and even some DMS.  They tell me that’s it’s impossible, but I’m sure that I could detect a hint of aromatic oak in the very end as I licked my lips.  Medium body and a lasting bitterness.  Moderate carbonation--higher than one may expect from a cask.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2009 RBESG 08 ... Hazy yellow ... big head ... very fruity loads of tart hoppyness pine and grapefruit ... loads of drying in linger ... juicy very very drinkable (esp for a non lager lover) very low carbonation. Drunk 28thJune, put in barrel on 3rd of June.
Oak barrel - hazy golden with white head. Aroma of yeast and hops. Nice bitterness in the end.

(6/26/08) Draught at Na Parkanu in Plzen. Hazy golden with a rather big and bubbly white head. Aroma of some yeast and nice grassy hoppiness. Flavor starts a bit malty sweet with some yeastiness and finishes with good grassy hops bitterness. Medium-bodied. Very fresh and tasty. 7/4/7/4/15=3.7

(6/27/08) From an oak barrel at the brewery in Plzen. Cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma has a lot of yeast, some oak and very nice grassy hoppiness. Sweet malty flavor with some caramel, some pleasant oakiness and a long bitter hoppy grassy finish with a little spicy hint. Medium-bodied with a rounded silky mouthfeel. Really refreshing and definitely the best Pilsener I’ve ever had. 7/4/8/5/16=4.0
Draught from wooden barrel at the brewery. What a nice beer. Light unclear amber - white head. Grainy, green grassm fresh hoppy, crispy. Nice bitterness. Very very nice....

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2009 Entered to celebrate my rating number 10,900 with a top 50 beer. Draft from the wooden barrel in the callars of the brewery. A hazy light golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma is sweet with notes of straw, malt, and citrusy notes of hops as well as hints of wood. The flavor is sweet with strong notes of straw and citrus as well as lighter notes of wood and sulpur. I am amazed how great this beer is - I had no idea a pilsner could be this great.The unfiltered version from steel tank: An unclear dark golden beer with a huge off-white head. The aroma is sweet with notes of malt, straw, hops, and grass. The flavor is sweetwith notes of grass, malt, and caramel, leading to a dry finish. [8/3/8/4/15=3.8]

On tap from a barrel at the cellars of Urquell. This is simply wonderfull. Beautiful looks... Aroma... and well everything. Very full and balanced. Gnoff and I were very lucky - I think 3 pints each.. Yeepee...

Tap - from a barrel in the wonderful Urquell Cellers. Pours a beautyful hazy/muddy orange wiht a nice big white head and lacing. Aroma is sweet with notes of hay and som grainyness... Very full and creamy mouthfeel with a sweet and hoppy flavour. NICE!

The master opera of Pilsner brewery. I was exceptical about whether an unfiltered lager is posible and definitely it is. You try it from the barrel in the Pilsner Brewery is only available for tourists. The sensation of natural carbonation is incredible, aroma is fresh. Yellow opaque colour with the best foam I’ve ever seen on a lager. Unfortunately in the tour I tried pellets of hop and the taste remained in my mouth for longer, then I couldn’t differenciate the biterness from the hop to that from the beer. However it has been my best experience with lagers . Well done Pilsner Urquell!!!

Wonderful. REAL beer.Unfiltered, unpasturised/unbeatable. Great temperature, straight from the barrel in the cellars. Had over 9 large plastic cups, onthe 2 times I went down there. Much, much better than the stuff they serve in the brewery restaurant/bar. The atmosphere is better, too. Highly recommended. Better than the filtered stuff they sell outside (but that is good, too!). Don’t settle for just the one glass - always ask for more!

Hazy golden color, creamy white head, lace. Malty and hoppy aroma with grainy and barnyardish notes. Very balanced malty, buttery with strong bitterness from Saaz hops. Velvety mouthfeel. This version lacks diacetylic flavors of normal Urquell.

UPDATED: JUL 11, 2008 (Draught/barrel) Pours a hazy, glowing golden with a big white head. The aroma is extremely fresh and well balanced with tones of straw and bread like malt alongside a good dose of floral, grassy and light herbal hops. The undertones reveal some sweet notes of toffee and fudge but there is also some hints of dew and dough. A light, subtle fruitiness way in the background. Some earth and sulphur hints. Maybe a touch of lemon and lime. Tart and yeasty. The flavour is fresh, robust and full with a discreet, light to medium, straw malt sweetness and a medium grassy and clean bitterness. Almost citric and oaky on the finish. The mouthfeel is refreshingly crisp, creamy, light numbing and juicy with a dry finish. The aftertaste is pale malty with some herbal/floral freshness creping up on you. Medium full bodied. A perfect Pilsner.

Tap, straight from the barrel in the Urquell cellars.
Pours a wonderful hazy coppery golden with the creamiest, most white-looking head I’ve ever seen. And it stays there for a million years - even after sipping. Afterwards, quite a lot of the head is laced all over the sides of my glass (not plastic cup, thankfully). Aroma is good, though it’s very subdued. Some oak, fresh grassy hops, grainy maltiness and a biscuity character shows up. Incredible mouthfeel for a pilsner, low carbonation, easily drinkable and very creamy. Flavour starts of with a pleasant sweetness, a strong malty character, very crisp and clean. Finish has good defining bitterness with great hop flavours and subdued oakiness. Aftertaste is amazingly long, dry and oaky... amazing!

Draught at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Hazy pale golden coloured, medium sized long-lasting white head, light hoppy nose. Sweet malty, nice hoppy and grassy taste with pleasant fruity and yeasty notes. Moderate bitter finish. Very nice bohemian pils.

Tank beer, several at Na Parkanu, Plzen. Hazed gold with white head. Malty Pilsener with a light farmy nose, though this quickly dispersed, good herby hop notes giving quite a full palate for this type of beer. Some yeastiness with an acidic bitterness, nice and lasting. 
Then the next day from wooden barrels in the Brewery. This was a little different, there was a sweeter touch to it with some hints of of a burnt caramel and just a tad more colour. I preferred the Brewery wooden barrelled beer a little more.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2013 Hazy golden beer ith a lasting white head leaving a fine lace. 

At the brewery tour: Top marks for ambience in this magical cellar with the wooden lagering barrels. Malty aroma with a touch of sulphur - but the musty cellar isnt perfect for beer sniffing. Full bodied malty flavour quickly to be followed by a rich hop flavour and bitterness. A hint of tannin in the aftertaste, unless thats just my imagination. 6-4-8-4-15=3.7

At Na Parkanu: Malty aroma with even less sulphur. Some grassy hops too. Lots of malt sweetness and biscuit flavour plays backbone to a fine hop flavour and strong bitterness. I far preferred this version, or maybe just that the setting was better for serious tasting.

Golden colour, big white head. Aroma is malts, yeast, some hints of bread as well as mild notes of eggyness. Flavour is malts, yeast, hops, some diacetyl and a bit of breadyness. 7 4 7 4 15.

UPDATED: JUL 9, 2008 On tap at Na Parkanu.  I had been travelling all day from London to Plzen and I had humped my luggage halfway across town to my hotel, before heading down here to meet up with the rest of the RBESG.  I hadnt had a drink all day and it had been very hot by English standards.  So by 19.30 I was gasping for a cold beer.  Which makes this probably explains partly why I liked it so much.  Slightly cloudy gold, thick off white head.  Earthy aroma.  Yeast.  This is gorgeous.  Some bitterness/yeast/earthy.  So refreshing.  Almost tastes as if it was dryhopped with earthy hops.  That is awesome. 4.3/5.0.
Re-rate 2 days later on the Saturday evening with Chris_o and Ruth. I still absolutely loved this, but I knocked 0.1 off now that I had time to reflect more on it.  Still the best Czech beer I had over the weekend and the only one I conciously went back for.  We had a filtered pint inbetween 2 unfiltered and the difference really was startling.  The unfiltered is just so much better.
Re-rate-unfiltered from the brewery from the wood.  Hazy gold, thin lasting white head, slightly woody yeast, hoppy aroma.  I think maybe more intense than the Na Parkanu version, bit more uncultured, more hoppy, but I prefer the Na Parkanu more 3.8/5.0

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2008 RBESG, on tap at na Parkanu, alongside &#40;iirc&#41; omhper, DSG and oh6gdx Poured a hazy gold body with a big fluffy white head that went away slowly. Man I hate the fact that I might be underrating this, but I wasnt as impressed as I was with some beers earlier that day.  A very grainy nose with some nice hopiness. Taste. Notes of orange, lovely hoppy taste. Strong hoppy bitterness near the end. Herbal, chewy, somewhat dusty. I hope to try this again as soon as I can. I really have this nagging feeling that Ive missed something.
This is the version to have. Whilst the bottled version is unoffensive enough, this version tells you what it is all about. Classic

5 pints on tap got a 4, however this is a different beer as its from the barrel and is fermented completly differently as it should be in a wooden barrel. Looks utterly beautiful. Aroma is biscuity bready malt, herbal grassy subtlke peppery hop character. Its super balanced and super drinkable. Awsome stuff.

RB#5200: From the barrel at the brewery. Pours hazy golden yellow with a creamy and white head. Aroma dry malty and light spiced hoppy. Flavour is smooth malty with a light bitterness showing through. Delicate fruity flavour and mild acidity. Ends smooth and medium bitter. Great, I really enjoyed getting a second glass of this.7-4-8-4-15=3.8

From tap at Na Parkanu. Pours hazy orange with q creamy off-white head. Aroma mild yeasty and light cornish. Flavour is smooth yeasty and mild cornish. Fresh hoppy flavour too. Shows a light bitterness to a very nice fruity hops and yeast flavour into the finish. Lovely pilsner.7-4-8-4-15=3.8

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2009 Draught both at the brewery and at Na Parkanu. Deep hazy golden with a small white head. Wonderful bready and slightly caramelly malt aroma, with fresh floral hops. Light to medium bodied with soft mouthfeel. Long bitter finish. A suberb refreshing and very flavourful beer.

Draught at the brewery (from oak)  Cloudy golden, small creamy head. Evident grassy saaz hop aroma. Dry and clean. I seem to sense a bit of oakiness in the crisp malt character. Light-medium bodied. Feels alive and fresh and finishes with lingering bitter finish. One of the top beers of the style!

The unfiltered one at Na Parkanu is understandably similar. If something it felt a bit more grainy, and I couldnt detect the very vague oakiness I thought I sensed at the brewery tour.

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2008 Draught @ the brewery. This was the barrel aged version, and boy had I been waiting for this one. My wife took a sip of her glass and gave the rest to me, so I ended up with two glasses of this wonderful brew. It was possible to take the glass out of the brewery and I was sipping away for over an hour. Quite amazingly the beer really opened up as every minute passed. This was and properly well be the best Pilsener that I will ever taste. If I could only drink one beer for the rest of my life, this would properly be it. As the brew master pored into the glass, a huge thick fin foamed head was forming and slowly settled into a medium - large almost creamy like white head. Color was cloudy shining gold with a sparkling appearance. Aroma was hope juice, mild grassy, citrus, hope oiled, dusty  earthy floral or flower like. As time passed the lovely dry wood notes began to surface with hint of tingling toasted malty notes. The palate was again a chapter in it self with unbelievable chewy creamy smooth hoppy texture, mild fruity notes and again wood dry feel. Medium to almost full bodied with a surprisingly lively carbonation. Flavor was just so well balanced with moderated to almost heavy bitter - sweet and what could appear as a hint of acidic. Lingering wood and earthy  dusty floral finish. This just was so tasty and amazingly well balanced. It might have been the surroundings or the tour and magic of being there, but I really did have an exceptional experience with this beer.

aroma: very malty, yeasty, a little tartness, some wood and minerals
flavor: tartness, yeast, malt, toasted dirt and bugs
palate: smooth with a tart bite, nice yeast aftertaste

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Draft at Na Parkanu in Plzen served in a dimpled 500ml mug

This is the same beer as that which is served on the brewery tour, only this one is from the tanks while the tour provides you with the wood barrel version.

Cloudy bright brass colored body with a large fluffy white head. The nose is amazingly fresh hoppy Saaz cones, moderate yeast presence noticed, and the smell is perfectly balanced clean pils malt and dry, grassy hops.  Flavor is wet and delicious and slightly sweet up front, then crispness explodes in a rush of grassy, fresh Saaz... drying and bittering into a long, refreshing finish complete with some lemon zest, faint minerally yeast notes and crisp cracker pils malt.  Hands down the best pilsener Ive ever had (8/5/10/5/18 = 4.6), until about two hours later, when 


At the end of the Plzensky Prazdroj tour, we sampled the Kvasnicovy from the wooden barrel.  The look is still a cloudy, soft gold and the head is still rocky and foamy and attractive.  The nose has a burst of funky yeast and tart, dry, (mildly) pungent wood.  Flavor has some amazing dry wood over the back, a light funk that is unique and almost confuses my tongue.  Amazingly refreshing overall, the finish has that mild wood and medium to heavy yeast presence to go along with the crisp, crackery, dry malt and dry, grassy hops.  This one stands up to scrutiny, its a fantastic pilsener and youll have trouble finding a better one.

From the wood barrel: 9/5/10/5/17 = 4.6

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2008 Draft at Na Parkanu and from the barrel on the brewery tour.  As in Glouglouburps fantastic scientific presentation rating, my number stands for the barrel version from the tour. 
Considering that my guide gave me a big cup and told me to go get a second helping( I had built up a mighty thirst on the two hour + tour) I was as close to heaven as a living man is able to get. While the unfiltered and unpasturized version of this critter is yeasty, raw oak infused and has some citrus zest, the peary/peach nose then peppery hop tones were the highlight for me.  Some agressive hopping enable this beer to extend its nice dry finish into something that makes your taste buds awaken and drool for another mouthful.  At one point I thought I would pull a Mickey Rourke from Barfly and just stick my mouth under the tap.  This beer is truly worth the pilgramage to the hallowed caves.  Outstanding and humbling.

[Unfiltered, unpasteurized, barrel-fermented. From the brewery tour] 

Very cloudy yellowish/golden color. Nice dense foam on top of my small sample glass. Aroma is FRESH. Fresh yeast, fresh grassy hops. Delicious. The malt character seems to be a bit subdued by all the other complexities of this beer. Yeast character is quite dominant, but not really overpowering (or providing much, if any diacetyl.). Hop character is strong and grassy. Quite bitter. The fermentation within the barrel seems to provide some interesting character to the beer overall... kind of musty and wet. Another layer of complexity. 

Overall, this beer was one of the highlights of my beer-focused trip abroad.  Outstanding, overall. Ill be lucky if Im able to try this one again.

UPDATED: MAY 15, 2008 IMPORTANT NOTE: There exists many versions of this beer.  The unfiltered Pilsner Urquell available at Na Parkanu, the un-pasteurized Pilsner Urquell available at U Zlatého Tygra and the unfiltered-un-pasteurized in wooden Pilsner Urquell Barrel available at the end of the brewery tour.  I see that people are entering ratings for the regulars and wooden-barrel ones here.  Im reviewing all three but the score is for the wooden barrel one.  The two first one can arguably remain one entry in ratebeer but the one aged in wooden barrels should definitely be a separate entry.  It is totally different from the other  two.  Totally different aroma and taste.  It even looks totally different
Unfiltered Pilsner Urquell: 3.9
In short: Typical 
How: Tap at Na Parkanu, Pilsen, Czech Republic
The look: Almost clear golden body with a large but quickly diminishing white head.
In long: Overall rather inexpressive malts with some pleasant hay.  Hopping is something else, wonderful hops bouquet.  Sharp medium bitterness with a little lemon twist.  The beer gets dry before the finish and the finish is very dry.  Didnt feel unbalanced despite the intense hopping and inexpressive malts. 
Un-pasteurized Pilsner Urquell: 3.8
How: Tap at U Zlatého Tygra
The look: Almost clear golden body with a large off-white head.
In long: Very similar to the above but with a little tiny bit of added acidity. 
Unfiltered un-pasteurized aged in wooden barrel Pilsner Urquell:4.9
How: From the barrel at the end of the brewery tour
The look: Cloudy golden yellow body with a small white head.
In long: Round and chewy body.  Very woody but a different type of wood than what we get from that new trend of barrel-aged-xyz.  This felt like freshly cut wet wood.  Unlike its non-barrel-aged unfiltered sisters the hopping on that one is dry grassy and slightly lemony.  Here it felt juicy citrusy which is obviously something coming of a strange alliance between the wood barrels and the hops.  Some dry grass on the come-back only.  Softer than usual carbonation and it fitted perfectly with the fresh chewy juicy body.  Fruity notes are light but rather complex with peaches, bananas, pears and more.  But overall its that freshness feeling that enchanted me.  During my Czech Republic pub crawl the freshness was a key ingredient but never as much as in this beer.  This felts like it was just harvested from some kind of magical beer tree.  To say this beer is highly drinkable is an understatement. 
In Conclusion:While the unfiltered and un-pasteurized Pilsner Urquells are superior Pilsners (certainly far superior to the regular Pilsner Urquell) it is really the unfiltered-un-pasteurized aged in wooden barrel Pilsner Urquell that is the shit.  Brewed in very limited quantity it unfortunately never leaves the wet caves of the brewery.  It is unfortunate that like the penis of an obese man this beer will never see the light of day because it will remain alone in its wet and moist spot and no-one will ever abuse it.

Had it in the magic cellar...
Hazy gold with small white head. Flowery hops and clean malts, fresh cut grass in the aroma, silky smooth texture that tastes like well....anything you want to taste in a good pilsner. Truly the godfather of all pilsners.

Went to the brewery on the second of april. Had this beer straight from the wooden barrel in the cellar of the brewery, wich isnt in use anymore for production. the beer unfiltered and unpasteurizized is much more tasteful than the bottle version. I dont understand why they do that anyway.

UPDATED: FEB 5, 2011 pisner from brewery cellas is the best what i drunk ( else 5 years ago) pity that regular pisner is not so good
rerate february 2011:
on tap in Na parkánu Pilsen
strong Yeast aroma, hoppy aroma too, golden yellow, hazy, white head, heavy bitterness, medium sweatness, bready body, good but lot of CO2 and too strong aroma for yeast...
