text: Had it in Plzen right from the barrel. Perhaps the greatest beer in the world. Even all the girls and non-beer-appreciators we were with loved it. THE TRUE PILSNER. however its nothing like the worldwide distributed pilsner urquell(even though you can sort of taste the relation, which i found to be really neat)

From the barrel at the end of the brewery tour in Plzen. Head is white, mostly lasting. Body is hazy medium to dark yellow. Aroma is moderately malty (toasted bread/grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs), lightly yeasty (basement), with notes of pineapple juice and gum. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Not quite worth the somewhat dull tour, but its interesting and kind of odd that such a thing exists from such a large brewery. Its sourish, as portended by the yeasty state its in, but in a slightly harsh fruit-juicy kind of way (as one or two other unfiltered lagers I had on this trip were, much like British bitters can be when the cask is old), which becomes more prominent as it warms. Fun to have tried, but Im not sure Id even buy this if it were readily available in my home town.  The Kout svetly is way better IMHO.

Tasted at both the tunnels under the brewery and at the beer hall in the town. In the underground brewery tour you get a glass filled directly out of the oak barrel. Amazing experience. Very cloudy, a little hoppier than the regular stuff, and uniquely pilsener. One taste and youll have a hard time drinking the regular stuff again.

Straight from the barrel in the catacombs of underground Plsensky Prazdroj.  A truly special beer moment: pours from the barrel slightly darker, more orange than the pastuerized stepchild commonly dispersed throughout the world; the unfiltered yeast that shows up as rich and hazy in the plastic cup gives wonderful depth and dimension to the mouthfeel: creamy, velvety, with much more malt sweetness, slightly tart, and a smooth yeasty finish.  Citrus rind hops on the nose, minty towards the finish.  Just a truly special experience, with the rating only somewhat slanted accordingly, as the beer itself deserves the highest praise.

UPDATED: MAY 12, 2009 Sampled from the wooden barrel at "beer world" in Plzen. As soon as my lips touched the cup (plastic) I wanted to kill everyone at the Urquell brewery for not bottling this elixir and instead the other stuff that hits the shelves Its a different beer from the mediocre tipple they market to the masses but this is real pilsner and Ive never had anything like it before or since. I think about this beer a lot, it haunts my memory. Very special stuff The bright orange, hazy color, the full-on hop aromas and especially flavors that burst through and permeate the palate, like no other pilsener I have ever tasted thats for sure. If all pilsener were like this, the world would be a better place.

Tasted at Na Parkanu, Plzen.
Granted. This really is a looker. Perfectly poured with a big lasting white head over a hazy yellow body. However, having read all of the rave reviews on this site I have to say that it disappoints a bit. Perhaps the version from the cellars is different and better.
This is not to say that its a very nice beer. I just didnt find it *that* good.
Anyways. Light hoppy scent with notes of honey and citrus fruits. Flavour is quite sharp, precise, and very well balanced. Easily drinkable and superbly refreshing yet surprisingly full bodied for its style. A bit more complexity and this would be very, very good. As it is I just found it to be a very good pilsener and not much more.
Its just a shame that this beer cannot be released for sale. Its just as good as it gets.
Vive la Pilsner Urquell!  The best golden beer to drink in the whole wide world.

From barrel in brewery cellar - Beautiful very hazy golden body, beautiful quite big bubbled white head; Big super fresh nose, superb balance of hop and malt, elegant and superbly composed; Perfect soft smooth texture, perfect slightly sharp carbonation, super complex, super fresh body, malty and hoppy bitter with a very little malty sweetness; Super elegant finish, long perfectly evolving, again perfect malt and hop bitter, perfectly balanced aromas of malt and earthy hop. Extremely well composed and extremely well made beer..........From Na Parkanu  (8-4-8-5-16 = 4.1) - Slightly hazy golden body, fluffy white head, lacing; Super crisp quite complex light roasted malty aromas, very elegant; Perfect medium sized carbonation on soft thin body, elegant crisp and malty bitter; Long very elegant malty crisp finish, malty bitter, great and complex malty aromas, crisp earthy spicy hop aromas in late finish. Super good very drinkable, actually a fantastic beer............If those 2 beers are exactly the same the small journey from the brewery to the bar seriously changes  it!

wow, thats all i can say, wow. went to the czech republic and had a first hand sample right from the cellars themselves. arguably one of the best beers ever,a darker cloudier version of the original but more flavor and smoothness come from it. could drink it all day.

UPDATED: JUL 30, 2007 Went to the brewery and sampled the unfiltered version. Quite dark for a pils, fantastic hoppy aroma, smooth bitter flavour. Obviously different from the filtered version. World class.
Tasted at Na Parkánu. Surprisingly clean (compared to the filtered stuff) with a balance and freshness that is quite unique. Only a few other pale lagers come close.

On tap at Na Parkanu. A big improvement over the regular Urquell I think, but then thats also quite variable from pub to pub. Much richer taste, that real freshness thats got a bite to it. Has got the touch of creaminess that the regular Urquell is missing, and also a more pleasing finish.
UPDATED: JUL 30, 2008 Simply the best.  A sharp, clean taste with a slight bitterness that leaves you wanting more. What all other Pilseners should be judged by.
In a brilliand way thise one! had it cold at 6 A 7 celsius and its like many years ago the traditional bohemian pilsener, the simple example of beer with the only 3 ingredients.

Nothing beats this beer.  I have tried it from the brewery in Plzen and no other beer compares to this true original.  The Saaz hops are number one in the world.  There are young women that pick these in the fields.  Bohemia is where all and any real beer has come from and there is no better place to have it than from the original brewery.

I had the opportunity to have this at the brewery. Its thick and looks like a weis or a whit, but its got bite and flavor. Thick but refreshing in the mouth. Worth trying if 
you ever get the opportunity.

Had this one during the brewery tour out of one of the barrels. Beautiful hazy golden color, short head. Aroma and taste of a perfect bohemian pilsener, nicely bitter, complex. Probably the best pilsener i have ever tasted.

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2007 On tap (from the barrel at the brewery 30 days "old", at the pub U Parkanu 60 days "old") Hazy, golden coloured, fluffy to firm head; fresh, fruity nose with a touch of yeast and hoppiness (Saazer Roter Mittelfrüh); creamy mouthfeel, not so malty as the filtered version, but a nice bitter-sweet flavour. Soft, but distinctive bitter-aromatic finish. Extremely well quaffable, well balanced..........Worth a journey, českemú pivu zdar !!!!!!!!

I drank this one straight from the barrel in the cellar of the brewery. The only place you can et this beer is in resaurant next to the brewery, the brewery, and one restaurant in Prague. This is what beer should taste like.

UPDATED: JUL 7, 2008 I tried this as a commercial version at the pub close to the brewery museum in Pilzen. I also tried it during the tour in the basement of the brewery, straight from a barrelTried it at two different occasions, both at Na Parkanu and in the tunnels at both visits.
Pretty special and a nice extra touch to this very special and great beer. Its even better when tasted unfiltered.Nice cloudy yeloow color, big fluffy frothy white head. Herbal hoppy fresh scent. Also hoppy herbal taste. Medium high bitterness. Amazing full fresh mouthfeel. Summery aftertaste.8/5/9/5/19=4.6RerateAt Na Parkanu on June 26, 2008: 8/4/8/4/16=4.0At the cellars having about 2 liters :) - Same rating as before: 8/5/9/5/19, just an amazingly nice pils.From Na Parkanu: Fruity hoppy tsate. Fresh fruity hoppy scent. Smooth mouthfeel. Medium bitterness. Shady orange color. Creamy white head.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2009 On tap at Na Parkanu in Plzen, in 2005 and 2008:

The Lure:Vibrating pink grapefruit with a little sugar on it. Starfruit, lemony hops and peppery freshness are bright at first, but slowly become veiled, as you get used to it. Not much maltiness here.

The Festivities:A plethora of citrus fruit combines with the white peppery yeast to develop a decorous but never overwhelming bitterness. Body is quenching and very slender, maybe a bit thinner in its maltiness than the regular Pilsner Urquell. Gorgeous pink grapefruit, but obviously not of the Cascade-y origin, are lifted by the prickly and engaging carbonation. Orange zest and yeast hangs on to the back hop bitterness admirably well. This isnt that complex, but it is very flavorful and different from most Bohemian Pilseners. If it had a filet of malt similar to its filtered counterpart, it would be great I think, but as is it is not much more than any very good American Pale Ale can offer. Just very rare, historical, and pleasantly hoppy. 3.8/5

Transcendence:The sight and warming of dawn.

At the end of the brewery tour:
The body appears to be slightly fuller and the hops are truly evocative, ramifying into coniferous, wooden notes as they lay sheets of bitterness onto the tongue. Hoppier, bulkier, yet as fresh and drinkable as any other Pilsner Urquell. The wooden barrel job is simply perfect and its link with the hops is stunning. Much better than the already very good kvasnicovy from stainless steel tanks available at Na Parkanu. 4.3/5

At the brewery, in the cellars, plastic cup. 
Hazy, almost yellow, cottony head. Big aroma from exotic fruits and Saaz. Herbal, almost tea-like in flavour with a tang of peach. Distinct but very well balanced bitterness. After, we went to Na Parkanu, but THEY DID NOT HAVE IT!

It is great to have a look at my fellow countrymens ratings. Not just out of interest but to see what I have missed. This is truly a delightful beer and now that it has been separately included in the database I can talk about a beautifully presented and flavoursome drink. On my tour were 4 Germans, 2 Frenchmen and an Austrian. All thought their drinks were the superior ones, much to the disgust of the Czech guide. He dispensed little samples to them and as they wandered off kept me back and poured a full half litre from the wood. Well you get what you drink. Clean and gentle with a genuine hit of the Zatec (Czech for Saaz) this one is a mothers milk type of experience that can only be expereinced at the original source.

UPDATED: JAN 16, 2009 on tap at na parkanu in plzen and on the pu brewery tour. lagered in wooden barrels. quite hazy and golden with a big whipped cream head. very fresh aroma of peach and saaz. quite a grassy flavour hint of iced tea and then loads of bitterness tastes like chewing on a saaz pellet. not sure if its any better than the regular draught pu at na spilce at the brewery. the yeast gves it a kellerbier character with a hint of passionfruit and slight yeast bite but the taste is not quite as clean as the regular urquell. well worth a visit to na parkanu which is located next to the brewing museum just off the main square in plzen. tasting it on the brewery tour has the advantage of being direct from the barrel in the cellar but you do have to sit through a tedious promotional video
